properties.name: ministry-of-foreign-and-european-affairs-of-the-slovak-republic
properties.title: Ministry Of Foreign And European Affairs Of The Slovak Republic
properties.description:
The opendata.mzv.sk portal was created for the purpose of making open data from the activities of the Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs of the Slovak Republic available. The portal's content consists of datasets in machine-readable format according to the standards for providing data in the electronic environment, in accordance with Decree No. 78/2020 on standards for information technologies of public administration. The portal's content and terms of use are subject to the Creative Commons CC0 license.

*Translated from Slovak*

---

**Original Text:**
Portál opendata.mzv.sk bol vytvorený za účelom sprístupnenia otvorených údajov z činnosti Ministerstva zahraničných vecí a európskych záležitostí SR. Obsah portálu tvoria datasety v strojovo spracovateľnej forme podľa štandardov poskytovania údajov v elektronickom prostredí v súlade s Vyhláškou č.78/2020 o štandardoch pre informačné technológie verejnej správy. Obsah portálu a podmienky jeho použitia poliehajú licencii Creative Commons CC0.

properties.name: open-data-portal-for-emenscr
properties.title: Open Data Portal for eMENSCR
properties.description:
The Cabinet resolution on March 12, 2019, approved the government agencies to support, develop, and integrate relevant data for the creation of indicators for the master plan under the national strategy, for the benefit of monitoring and evaluating the implementation of the national strategy, the master plan under the national strategy, and other related plans. Subsequently, the Cabinet resolution on December 3, 2019, approved the government agencies to import statistical data, situations, or any other data into the eMENSCR system for monitoring, inspection, and evaluation of the implementation of the national strategy and the national reform plan, to drive the implementation towards the same goal in a concrete manner. The National Economic and Social Development Council (NESDC) has therefore established a government open data portal to support the monitoring and evaluation of operations under the national strategy (Open Data Portal for Monitoring and Evaluating Government Projects under National Strategy) to link information datasets between government agencies. It allows the import of statistical data, situations, or other data from eMENSCR, especially those consistent with the national strategy and the master plan under the national strategy, to facilitate service users from the public sector, the private business sector, and government agencies to benefit from government open data. This allows them to search and access quality, up-to-date, secure, and safe data, as well as provides a channel for monitoring government operations and the implementation under the national strategy.

*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
มติคณะรัฐมนตรีเมื่อวันที่ 12 มีนาคม 2562 เห็นชอบให้หน่วยงานของรัฐดำเนินการสนับสนุน พัฒนา และบูรณาการข้อมูลที่เกี่ยวข้องสำหรับการทำตัวชี้วัดของแผนแม่บทภายใต้ยุทธศาสตร์ชาติ เพื่อประโยชน์ในการติดตาม ประเมินผลการดำเนินการตามยุทธศาสตร์ชาติ แผนแม่บทภายใต้ยุทธศาสตร์ชาติ และแผนอื่น ๆ ที่เกี่ยวข้อง และต่อมาได้มีมติคณะรัฐมนตรีเมื่อวันที่ 3 ธันวาคม 2562 เห็นชอบให้หน่วยงานของรัฐดำเนินการนำเข้าข้อมูลสถิติ สถานการณ์ หรือข้อมูลอื่นใดในระบบ eMENSCR สำหรับการติดตาม ตรวจสอบ และประเมินผลการดำเนินการตามยุทธศาสตร์ชาติและแผนการปฏิรูปประเทศ ให้เกิดการขับเคลื่อนไปสู่เป้าหมายเดียวกันอย่างเป็นรูปธรรมต่อไป สำนักงานสภาพัฒนาการเศรษฐกิจและสังคมแห่งชาติ จึงได้ดำเนินการจัดทำฐานข้อมูลเปิดภาครัฐเพื่อสนับสนุนการติดตามและประเมินผลการดำเนินงานตามยุทธศาสตร์ชาติ (Open Data Portal for Monitoring and Evaluating Government Projects under National Strategy) เพื่อเชื่อมโยงชุดข้อมูลสารสนเทศระหว่างหน่วยงานภาครัฐ สามารถนำเข้าข้อมูลสถิติ สถานการณ์ หรือข้อมูลอื่นจาก eMENSCR โดยเฉพาะที่สอดคล้องกับยุทธศาสตร์ชาติ แผนแม่บทภายใต้ยุทธศาสตร์ชาติ เพื่ออำนวยความสะดวกให้กับผู้ใช้บริการทั้งภาคประชาชน ภาคธุรกิจเอกชน รวมถึงหน่วยงานของรัฐ สามารถใช้ประโยชน์จากข้อมูลเปิดภาครัฐ ในการค้นหาและเข้าถึงข้อมูลที่มีคุณภาพ ทันสมัย มั่นคงและมีความปลอดภัย รวมทั้งเป็นช่องทางในการตรวจสอบการดำเนินการของภาครัฐ และการดำเนินงานภายใต้ยุทธศาสตร์ชาติได้

properties.name: nhsbsa-open-data-portal
properties.title: NHSBSA Open Data Portal
properties.description: Welcome to the NHS Business Services Authority’s (NHSBSA) Open Data Portal, the home of all our open data. All of our data is released under the Open Government License and is free for use and re-use. We want to put users at the heart of what we do. You can see what we’re working on at the minute on our Open Data Roadmap that is hosted on our GitHub. You can help shape what we do next by giving us feedback on our roadmap and making suggestions for what data sets you would like see published or expanded on. The Open Data Portal is powered by CKAN - an open source data management system. You can see the code that has been created to help support this implementation of CKAN in a series of public GitHub repositories:

properties.name: national-research-council-of-thailand
properties.title: National Research Council Of Thailand (NRCT)
properties.description:
OPEN DATA Open data from the National Research Office (NRCT)
The Constitution of the Kingdom of Thailand B.E. 2560, the Official Information Act B.E. 2540, and the Digital Government Administration and Service Act B.E. 2562 stipulate that government agencies must prepare information that must be disclosed under the Official Information Act in digital form to the public. The general public must be able to access it freely without charge and can disseminate, utilize, or develop services and innovations in various forms, including demonstrating transparency in operations and making them auditable by all sectors.

According to the Royal Gazette, the announcement of the Digital Government Development Committee was published on 24 June 2020 on standards and criteria for disclosing open government data in digital form to the public for the benefit of facilitating people to access data and setting guidelines and standards for government agencies to deliver or link such data to the public at the Open Government Data of Thailand Center at the website data.go.th.

Open government data is “data that government agencies must disclose to the public under the Government Information Act in a digital format that can be accessed and used freely, without platform restrictions, without cost, published, reproduced or utilized for any purpose.” In short, it is government data that has gone through a data secrecy process and is considered “public data.” Users can use, analyze or modify this data as needed.

An inventory is a document that lists all the data sets, grouped or classified, in the possession or control of a government agency.

Data descriptions that comply with the standards set by the NESDB are the mandatory metadata descriptions for government data sets, which are 14 mandatory data descriptions for each data set that government agencies must prepare and provide details about.

Data accounting system is a system that manages the data accounting of an organization, such as CKAN or others.

Public information is information that can be disclosed and used freely, whether it is news information, personal information, or electronic information.

Open features are features of a file that are not restricted by any conditions from the product owner. They are freely accessible without any cost to use or process in a variety of software.

The National Research Office (NRCT) is an agency with duties and powers related to research and innovation funding, creating a database and index of national science, research, and innovation, initiating, driving, and coordinating the implementation of important research and innovation projects of the country, establishing research standards and ethics, promoting and transferring knowledge for use, promoting and supporting the development of research and innovation personnel, and granting awards, certificates of honor, or praising individuals or agencies related to research and innovation. All operational data of the National Research Office (NRCT) is therefore an important part used to support various research and innovation activities, including national development, such as using it to support the implementation of digital economic and social policies for all sectors to use data to develop services or further develop innovations, etc. Therefore, the disclosure of government data by the National Research Office (NRCT) is important for the use of research and innovation data for national development. Therefore, it has a policy to implement a data governance framework and develop a data catalog system to lead to the disclosure of government data (Open Data).



*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
OPEN DATA ข้อมูลเปิดสำนักงานการวิจัยแห่งชาติ (วช.)
รัฐธรรมนูญแห่งราชอาณาจักรไทย พ.ศ. 2560 พระราชบัญญัติข้อมูลข่าวสารของทางราชการ พ.ศ. 2540 และพระราชบัญญัติการบริหารงานและการให้บริการภาครัฐผ่านระบบดิจิทัล พ.ศ. 2562 ได้กำหนดให้หน่วยงานของรัฐจัดทำข้อมูลที่ต้องเปิดเผยตามกฎหมายว่าด้วยข้อมูลข่าวสารของราชการ ในรูปแบบข้อมูลดิจิทัลต่อสาธารณะ โดยต้องให้ประชาชนทั่วไปสามารถเข้าถึงได้อย่างเสรีโดยไม่เสียค่าใช้จ่าย และสามารถนำไปเผยแพร่ ใช้ประโยชน์ หรือพัฒนาบริการและนวัตกรรมในรูปแบบต่าง ๆ ได้ รวมถึงแสดงความโปร่งใสในการดำเนินงาน และสามารถตรวจสอบได้จากทุกภาคส่วน

ตาม ราชกิจจานุเบกษา เผยแพร่ประกาศคณะกรรมการพัฒนารัฐบาลดิจิทัล เมื่อวันที่ 24 มิถุนายน 2563 เรื่อง มาตรฐานและหลักเกณฑ์การเปิดเผยข้อมูลเปิดภาครัฐในรูปแบบข้อมูลดิจิทัลต่อสาธารณะเพื่อประโยชน์ในการอำนวยความสะดวกแก่ประชาชนในการเข้าถึงข้อมูล และกำหนดแนวทางและมาตรฐานให้หน่วยงานของรัฐจัดส่งหรือเชื่อมโยงข้อมูลดังกล่าวเปิดเผยแก่ประชาชน ณ ศูนย์กลางข้อมูลเปิดภาครัฐ (Open Government Data of Thailand) ที่เว็บไซต์ data.go.th

ข้อมูลเปิดภาครัฐ คือ“ข้อมูลที่หน่วยงานของรัฐต้องเปิดเผยต่อสาธารณะตามกฎหมายว่าด้วยข้อมูลข่าวสารของราชการในรูปแบบข้อมูลดิจิทัลที่สามารถเข้าถึงและใช้ได้อย่างเสรี ไม่จำกัดแพลตฟอร์ม ไม่เสียค่าใช้จ่าย เผยแพร่ ทำซ้ำ หรือใช้ประโยชน์ได้โดยไม่จำกัดวัตถุประสงค์” หรือสรุปได้ว่า คือ ข้อมูลภาครัฐที่ผ่านกระบวนการจัดลำดับชั้นความลับของข้อมูลแล้วว่าเป็น “ข้อมูลสาธารณะ” ผู้ใช้งานสามารถนำข้อมูลเหล่านี้ไปใช้งาน วิเคราะห์ หรือดัดแปลงได้ตามความต้องการ

บัญชีข้อมูล คือ เอกสารแสดงบรรดารายการชุดข้อมูล ที่จำแนกแยกแยะโดยการจัดกลุ่มหรือ จัดประเภทข้อมูลที่อยู่ในความครอบครองหรือควบคุมของหน่วยงานของรัฐ

คำอธิบายข้อมูลที่สอดคล้องตามมาตรฐานที่ สพร. กำหนด คือ คำอธิบายข้อมูลส่วนหลัก (Mandatory Metadata) สำหรับชุดข้อมูลภาครัฐเป็นส่วนที่บังคับต้องทำการอธิบายข้อมูลประกอบด้วยคำอธิบายข้อมูลจำนวน 14 รายการ สำหรับ 1 ชุดข้อมูล ที่หน่วยงานของรัฐต้องจัดทำและระบุรายละเอียด

ระบบบัญชีข้อมูล คือ ระบบงานที่ทำหน้าที่บริหารจัดการบัญชีข้อมูลของหน่วยงาน เช่น CKAN หรือ อื่นๆ

ข้อมูลสาธารณะ คือ ข้อมูลที่สามารถเปิดเผยได้ สามารถนำไปใช้ได้อย่างอิสระไม่ว่าจะเป็นข้อมูลข่าวสาร ข้อมูลส่วนบุคคล ข้อมูลอิเล็กทรอนิกส์

คุณลักษณะแบบเปิด คือ คุณลักษณะของไฟล์ที่ไม่ถูกจำกัดด้วยเงื่อนไขต่างๆ จากเจ้าของผลิตภัณฑ์ สามารถเข้าถึงได้อย่างเสรีโดยไม่เสียค่าใช้จ่ายใช้งานหรือประมวลผลได้หลากหลายซอฟแวร์

สำนักงานการวิจัยแห่งชาติ (วช.) เป็นหน่วยงานที่มีหน้าที่และอำนาจเกี่ยวกับการให้ทุนวิจัยและนวัตกรรม การจัดทำฐานข้อมูลและดัชนีด้านวิทยาศาสตร์ วิจัยและนวัตกรรมของประเทศ การริเริ่ม ขับเคลื่อนและประสานการดำเนินงานโครงการวิจัยและนวัตกรรมที่สำคัญของประเทศ การจัดทำมาตรฐานและจริยธรรมการวิจัย การส่งเสริมและถ่ายทอดความรู้เพื่อใช้ประโยชน์ การส่งเสริมและสนับสนุนการพัฒนาบุคลากรด้านการวิจัยและนวัตกรรมและการให้รางวัล ประกาศเกียรติคุณ หรือ ยกย่องบุคคล หรือหน่วยงานด้านการวิจัยและนวัตกรรม ข้อมูลการดำเนินงานทั้งหมดของ สำนักงานการวิจัยแห่งชาติ (วช.) จึงถือเป็นส่วนสำคัญที่นำมาใช้สนับสนุนการดำเนินการกิจกรรมต่างๆ ด้านการวิจัยและนวัตกรรม รวมไปถึงการพัฒนาประเทศ เช่น นำมาใช้ในการสนับสนุนการขับเคลื่อนนโยบายเศรษฐกิจและสังคมดิจิทัลให้กับทุกภาคส่วนนำข้อมูลไปใช้ประโยชน์ในการพัฒนาบริการหรือต่อยอดนวัตกรรม เป็นต้น ดังนั้น  การเปิดเผยข้อมูลภาครัฐของ สำนักงานการวิจัยแห่งชาติ (วช.)  มีความสำคัญต่อการนำข้อมูลด้านการวิจัยและนวัตกรรมไปใช้ประโยชน์ในการพัฒนาประเทศ จึงมีนโยบายในการดำเนินการจัดทำกรอบการกำกับดูแลข้อมูล (Data Governance Framework) และพัฒนาระบบบัญชีข้อมูล (Data Catalog) เพื่อนำไปสู่การเปิดเผยข้อมูลภาครัฐ (Open Data)

properties.name: penghu-county-government-data-open-platform
properties.title: Penghu County Government Data Open Platform
properties.description:
Government Website Data Openness Declaration

1.  Authorization Method and Scope:

To facilitate the widespread use of website data by all sectors, all data and materials published on the Penghu County Government website, to the extent that they are protected by copyright, are provided to the public for use on a royalty-free, non-exclusive, and sublicensable basis. Users may, without limitation of time or region, reproduce, adapt, edit, publicly transmit, or otherwise utilize the data to develop various products or services (hereinafter referred to as "value-added derivatives"). This authorization will not be revoked subsequently, and users do not need to obtain written or other forms of authorization from this agency; however, the source must be acknowledged when using the data.

2.  Related Matters:

This authorization scope is limited to the scope of copyright protection and does not extend to other intellectual property rights, including but not limited to the provision of patents, trademarks, and agency logos. Whether personal data disclosed by parties themselves or disclosed by law may be collected, processed, and used is the responsibility of the user, who must plan and implement corresponding measures required by law in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Information Protection Act. Certain audio-visual materials, images, musical scores, articles written by designated personnel or for specific projects, or other works, require the agency's specific consent before they can be used. Users should be aware that they must not infringe upon the moral rights of third parties (including the right of authorship and the right to prohibit improper alteration). The provided data and materials must not have their related information maliciously altered. If the information displayed after use does not match the original data and materials, the user shall be solely responsible for civil and criminal legal liabilities. The authorization of this website does not grant users the status of representing this agency's recommendation, endorsement, or approval of their value-added derivatives.

*Translated from Korean*

---

properties.name: barcelona-port-open-data-portal
properties.title: Barcelona Port Open Data Portal (Portal Open Data del Port de Barcelona)
properties.description:
The Port of Barcelona publishes Open Data with the aim of providing services and information held by the administration. The following conditions bind any reuse agent with the aim of using the documents that have been sent to them: Licenses for Datasets. All datasets offered by the Port of Barcelona, unless otherwise indicated, are published under the terms of the Creative Commons-Attribution (CC-BY 4.0) license and allow: Acceptance of this Legal Notice does not imply the granting of copyright or intellectual property rights over the datasets. Definition of cookies: What are cookies? They are small text files that are stored locally on your computer's hard drive. When you revisit the same site, cookies allow the website to recognize your browser and, as a result, store your user preferences. The computer systems used by the APB (Port Authority of Barcelona) for the provision of these services may use their own, technical, and analytical cookies. At no time does the APB intend to obtain a commercial benefit from this operation, although in accordance with current regulations it informs users and understands that they explicitly accept this when visiting the APB website. Types and function of cookies: Cookies on the APB Open Data Portal. The APB Open Data Portal uses its own cookies, generated by its own routers and by the ckan server that provides service to this portal, as well as third-party cookies, specifically for analysis to obtain statistics on visits to the portal. We inform you that, in case of disabling the use of cookies, you may affect the functionalities offered by our website. Identification of those responsible for cookies and the processing of the data obtained:

**Original Text:**
El Port de Barcelona publica Open Data amb l'objectiu de proporcionar serveis i informació dipositats a l'administració. Les següents condicions vinculen qualsevol agent de reutilització amb l'objectiu de fer-ne ús dels documents que se'ls han enviat: Llicències per a Conjunts de Dades. Tots els conjunts de dades que ofereix el Port de Barcelona, si no s'indica altrament, es publiquen sota els termes de la llicència Creative Commons-Reconeixement (CC-per 4.0) i permet: L'acceptació d'aquest Avís Legal no implica la concessió de drets d'autor o propietat intel·lectual sobre els conjunts de dades. Definició de les cookies Què són les cookies o galetes? són petits arxius de text que s'emmagatzemen localment en el disc dur del vostre ordinador. Quan torneu a visitar el mateix lloc, les cookies permeten al lloc web reconèixer el vostre navegador i com a resultat, emmagatzemar les vostres preferències com a usuari. Els sistemes informàtics utilitzats per l'APB per a la prestació d'aquests serveis poden utilitzar cookies pròpies, tècniques, d'anàlisi. En cap moment l'APB té intenció d'obtenir un benefici comercial amb aquest funcionament, si bé d'acord amb la normativa vigent informa els usuaris i entén que aquests ho accepten explícitament en visitar la web de l'APB. Tipus i funció de les cookies: Cookies al Portal d'Open data de l'APB El Portal d'Open data de l'APB utilitza cookies pròpies, generades pels routers propis i pel servidor ckan que dona servei a aquest portal, a més de cookies de tercers, concretament d'anàlisi per obtenir estadístiques de les visites al portal. Us informem que, en cas de deshabilitar l'ús de les cookies, podeu incidir en les funcionalitats que ofereix la nostra web. properties.name: open-data-portal-porto
properties.title: Porto Open Data Portal (Portal de Dados Abertos)
properties.description:
Introduction to the Data Management and Valorization Plan of the Municipality of Porto. The fundamental premise of the global "Open Data" movement is based on the value generated from the reuse of public data for various purposes. The great added value resulting from open data, whether in terms of greater transparency of municipal activity or of general value for Academia and for citizens and companies, has, therefore, mobilized the public sector globally to develop strategies in this direction. In this context, the Municipality of Porto believes that in order to implement an impactful strategy that promotes the sustainable development of an open data platform, it is necessary to adopt a holistic and cross-cutting vision for the entire city. Based on this premise, the Municipality defined a Strategic Plan for Valorizing the data of the Municipality of Porto, which aims to ensure a true paradigm shift at the municipal level in the way data is managed and processed in its context. Current Open Data Paradigm The increasing informational demands that are felt, resulting from the advent of information technologies, have a strong impact on cities, not only due to the ever-increasing volume of data produced and available that needs to be managed and leveraged to improve municipal management, but also due to the continuous evolution of data analysis, exploration, and processing technologies. The exercise is not only about modernizing the technological structure, adapting it to the systems and mechanisms that are constantly updated, but, above all, seeking the continuous improvement of services provided to citizens, companies, and institutions. The availability and reuse of public sector data for private purposes or by Research & Development institutions can be an important contribution to the development of new services based on innovative ways of combining and using this data, stimulating economic growth, the production of scientific knowledge, and promoting social intervention. Vision of the Municipality of Porto regarding the current Open Data paradigm Among the values that guide the activity and culture of the Municipality of Porto, the following stand out: citizen orientation, continuous improvement, and innovation. In this context, and bearing in mind the growing importance assumed by data, information, and the knowledge that can be generated from it, the Municipality of Porto intends to respond to the challenge of the current open data paradigm. Open Data Portal of the Municipality of Porto With the aim of generating value through the provision of information that can be used and combined in order to generate knowledge by the most diverse agents of the city, the Municipality of Porto will implement an Open Data Portal. Therefore, the intention is that the Portal will be not only a data repository, but also a collaborative interface and active participation between the Municipality, citizens, companies, Academia, institutions, and other organizations and entities from the most diverse areas of intervention, in a more transparent and participatory governance strategy on the part of the city. This data, much of it georeferenced, is extremely useful, constituting a support for municipal activity, a tool to support decision-making, the delineation of well-informed and supported policies and strategies, in line with the objective of creating smart, inclusive, and sustainable cities, as enshrined in the Europe 2020 Strategy. Scope and objectives of this strategic document This document aims to systematize the guiding principles upstream of the creation of the Open Data Portal of the Municipality of Porto, contextualizing them in the current paradigm of providing data to citizens, Academia, companies, and other entities as a way to enhance governmental transparency and improve the participation of agents in the process of constructing knowledge about the city. 1) The open data policy Information is a necessity for any sector of human activity. Data/information is one of the main assets of organizations, regardless of their scope of activity. The transformation of information into knowledge is currently considered a factor of primary importance for the competitiveness of companies, institutions, and territories. The European Union, namely within the scope of the Digital Agenda for Europe, has been encouraging Member States to adopt open data initiatives. The reasons have to do with the fact that: 2) Vision and strategy of the Municipality of Porto regarding open data As a contribution to the implementation of European and national strategies in terms of public transparency, the process of providing open data to the city's agents by the Municipality of Porto has the following fundamental objectives: In this context, the Vision of the Municipality of Porto in this regard consists of maximizing the opportunities that arise from the availability and use of data and information from the Municipality, thus contributing to increasing and promoting the competitiveness of the city of Porto and the region transversally, for visiting, residing, studying, attracting, and doing business in the national and international market. 3) The Open Data Portal of the Municipality of Porto This Portal is based on the principles of open data and is made available by the Municipality of Porto with the aim of generating value for society. Open data reflects greater transparency of the Municipality, more active participation of the citizen, and potentiates the development of better and new private products and services. This Portal will be a driver of innovation, the improvement of municipal services, and the creation of knowledge with the combination of different data, assuming a role of great interest for the city. The Open Data Portal was developed by the Municipality of Porto, using the open source CKAN platform. Target Audience The open data of the city of Porto is intended for citizens (residents), entrepreneurs, tourists, researchers, students, and the community of programmers who intend to use them in the implementation of applications. What exists on the Portal? The Portal provides a catalog of metadata that aims to allow access to data from the Municipality of Porto or data shared by third parties, these being available in formats both for traditional human reading and for machines. The Portal also has a space for disseminating a selection of applications developed based on the data made available on it. How to participate in the Portal One of the objectives of the Portal is to encourage the participation of citizens, Academia and companies through the presentation of suggestions regarding publication, correction of detected errors, sharing of their own data and dissemination of the uses they make of the data. For this purpose, please contact: dados@cm-porto.pt Access to the data can be made by any anonymous User without the need to register on the Portal.

*Translated from Portuguese*

---

**Original Text:**
Introdução Plano de Gestão e Valorização de Dados do Município do Porto A premissa fundamental do movimento global "Dados Abertos" assenta no valor gerado a partir da reutilização de dados públicos para vários fins. O grande valor acrescentado decorrente dos dados abertos, seja no âmbito de maior transparência da atividade municipal ou de geral valor para a Academia e para os cidadãos e empresas, tem, portanto, mobilizado o setor público a nível global a desenvolver estratégias neste sentido. Neste contexto, o Município do Porto acredita que para implementar uma estratégia de impacto, que promova o desenvolvimento sustentável de uma plataforma de dados abertos, é necessário adotar uma visão holística e transversal a toda a cidade. Assente nessa premissa, o Município definiu um Plano Estratégico de Valorização de dados do Muncipio do Porto. que visa garantir uma verdadeira alteração de paradigma a nível municipal na forma como os dados são geridos e processados no seu contexto. Atual paradigma do Open Data As crescentes exigências informacionais que se fazem sentir, fruto do advento das tecnologias de informação, têm um forte impacto nas cidades, não só pelo volume cada vez maior de dados produzidos e disponíveis que precisam de ser geridos e potencializados para melhorar a gestão municipal, como pela contínua evolução das tecnologias de análise, exploração e processamento de dados. O exercício que se coloca não diz respeito apenas à modernização da estrutura tecnológica, adequando-a aos sistemas e mecanismos que se encontram em constante atualização, mas, e sobretudo, procurar a melhoria contínua dos serviços prestados aos cidadãos, empresas e instituições. A disponibilidade e reutilização dos dados do setor público para fins privados ou por parte das instituições de Investigação & Desenvolvimento pode constituir um importante contributo para o desenvolvimento de novos serviços baseados em modos inovadores de combinar e utilizar esses mesmos dados, estimulando o crescimento económico, a produção de conhecimento científico e promovendo a intervenção social. Visão do Município do Porto quanto ao atual paradigma do Open Data Entre os valores que orientam a atividade e a cultura do Município do Porto destacam-se a orientação para o cidadão, a melhoria contínua e a inovação. Neste âmbito, e tendo muito presente a crescente importância assumida pelos dados, da informação e do conhecimento que a partir deles pode ser gerado, o Município do Porto pretende responder ao desafio do atual paradigma de dados abertos. Portal de Dados Abertos do Município do Porto Com o intuito de gerar valor através da disponibilização de informação que pode ser utilizada e combinada de forma a gerar conhecimento pelos mais diversificados agentes da cidade, o Município do Porto vai implementar um Portal de Dados Abertos. Assim sendo, pretende-se que o Portal seja não só um repositório de dados, mas igualmente um interface colaborativo e de participação ativa entre o Município, os cidadãos, as empresas, a Academia, as instituições e demais organizações e entidades das mais diversas áreas de intervenção, numa estratégia de governação mais transparente e participativa, por parte da cidade. Estes dados, muitos deles georreferenciados, são extremamente úteis, constituindo um suporte à atividade municipal, uma ferramenta de apoio à tomada de decisão, à delineação de políticas e estratégias bem informadas e suportadas, em consonância com o objetivo de criação de cidades inteligentes, inclusivas e sustentáveis, plasmado na Estratégia Europa 2020. Âmbito e objetivos deste documento estratégico Com este documento pretende-se sistematizar os princípios orientadores a montante da criação do Portal de Dados Abertos do Município do Porto, contextualizando-os no atual paradigma de disponibilização de dados aos cidadãos, à Academia, empresas e demais entidades como forma de potenciar a transparência governativa e melhorar a participação dos agentes no processo de construção de conhecimento sobre a cidade. 1) A política de dados abertos A informação é uma necessidade para qualquer setor da atividade humana. Os dados/informação são um dos principais ativos das organizações, independentemente do seu âmbito de atuação. A transformação da informação em conhecimento é considerada, na atualidade, um fator de primeira importância para a competitividade das empresas, das instituições e dos territórios. A União Europeia, no âmbito nomeadamente da Agenda Digital para a Europa, tem vindo a incentivar os Estados-Membros a adotarem iniciativas de dados abertos. As razões prendem-se com o facto de: 2) Visão e estratégia do Município do Porto quanto aos dados abertos Como contributo para a concretização das estratégias europeias e nacionais em matéria de transparência pública, o processo de disponibilização de dados abertos aos agentes da cidade por parte do Município do Porto tem como objetivos fundamentais: Neste contexto, a Visão do Município do Porto a este respeito consiste em maximizar as oportunidades que advêm da disponibilização e uso de dados e informação do Município, contribuindo deste modo para incrementar e fomentar a competitividade da cidade do Porto e da região transversalmente, para a visitar, residir, estudar, captar e realizar negócios no mercado nacional e internacional. 3) O Portal de Dados Abertos do Município do Porto Este Portal tem como base os princípios dos dados abertos e é disponibilizado pelo Município do Porto com o intuito de gerar valor para a sociedade. Os dados abertos refletem uma maior transparência do Município, uma participação mais ativa do munícipe e potenciam o desenvolvimento de melhores e novos produtos e serviços privados. Este Portal será potenciador da inovação, da melhoria dos serviços municipais e da criação de conhecimento com a combinação de diferentes dados, assumindo um papel de grande interesse para a cidade. O Portal de Dados Abertos foi desenvolvido pelo Município do Porto, usando a plataforma open source CKAN. Público-alvo Os dados abertos da cidade do Porto destinam-se quer aos cidadãos (munícipes), empresários, turistas, investigadores, estudantes, quer à comunidade de programadores que os pretendam utilizar na implementação de aplicações. O que existe no Portal? O Portal fornece um catálogo de metadados que visam permitir o acesso a dados do Município do Porto ou a dados partilhados por terceiros, estando estes disponíveis em formatos tanto de leitura humana tradicional, como por máquinas. O Portal tem ainda um espaço de divulgação de uma seleção de aplicações desenvolvidas com base nos dados nele disponibilizados. Como participar no Portal Um dos objetivos do Portal consiste em fomentar a participação dos cidadãos, Academia e empresas através da apresentação de sugestões relativas à publicação, correção de erros detetados, partilha dos próprios dados e divulgação das utilizações que efetuarem com os dados. Para este efeito deve contactar: dados@cm-porto.pt O acesso aos dados pode ser efetuado por qualquer Utilizador anónimo sem necessidade de registo no Portal.

properties.name: toyama-prefecture-open-data-portal-site
properties.title: Toyama Prefecture Open Data Portal Site
properties.description:
Open data refers to an initiative to publicly release public data, such as statistical materials and literature materials held by government agencies, research institutions, private companies, etc., in a format that clearly states the usage rules and facilitates secondary use, as well as the data that is released in this manner. Generally, open data is published on the internet, and anyone can freely use and redistribute it, regardless of whether it is for profit or non-profit. It is also recommended that the data be provided in a format that allows for automatic data reuse by computers.

*Translated from Japanese*

---

**Original Text:**
オープンデータとは、行政や研究機関、民間企業等が保有する統計資料や文献資料を始めとした公共的なデータについて、利用ルールを明記し、二次利用しやすい形で公開する取り組み、及び、そのように公開されたデータのことを言います。 一般的にオープンデータは、インターネット上で公開されており、営利・非営利を問わず、誰もが自由に利用・再配布することができるとともに、コンピュータによる自動的なデータ再利用が可能なデータ形式での提供が推奨されています。

properties.name: schleswig-holstein-open-data
properties.title: Schleswig-Holstein Open Data
properties.description:
information
Open data refers to electronic data that is made available to the public, without any specific purpose or obligation. Open and structured access to freely available public data makes government action transparent, comprehensible, and verifiable. The Schleswig-Holstein Open Data Portal thus makes an important contribution to strengthening trust between politics, business, the media, and civil society. The state government's goal is to promote transparent and comprehensible government action.

The legal basis for the operation of the Open Data Portal is the Open Data Act of Public Administration (Open Data Act - ODaG) . Section 4 of the Act regulates the operation of the Open Data Portal.

Scope of data
The Schleswig-Holstein Open Data Portal will initially contain data from the state administration and municipal pilot projects. In the medium term, as many datasets as possible related to Schleswig-Holstein will be available via the platform. The data is openly accessible and can be freely used, processed, and distributed.

Machine access
Would you like to access Open Data Schleswig-Holstein data automatically? Learn how to do this in our developer documentation .

Providing information
State authorities, municipalities, companies, and other organizations (legal entities) can publish data on the Schleswig-Holstein Open Data Portal. Publication by individuals is not permitted. Initial information on providing data can be found in the Schleswig-Holstein Open Data Guide, which is available as a website and as a PDF document .

contact
If you have any questions or suggestions, we'll be happy to help. You can reach us by email at opendata@lr.landsh.de or via the contact form .

*Translated from German*

---

**Original Text:**
Informationen
Unter offenen Daten (Open Data) versteht man elektronische Daten, die der Allgemeinheit öffentlich, zweckfrei und unverbindlich zur Verfügung gestellt werden. Durch den offenen und strukturierten Zugang zu freiverfügbaren Datenbeständen der öffentlichen Hand, wird staatliches Handeln transparent, nachvollziehbar und überprüfbar. Damit leistet das Open Data Portal des Landes Schleswig-Holstein einen wichtigen Beitrag für die Stärkung des Vertrauens zwischen Politik, Wirtschaft, Medien und Zivilgesellschaft. Das Ziel der Landesregierung ist die Förderung eines transparenten und nachvollziehbaren Regierungshandelns.

Rechtsgrundlage für den Betrieb des Open-Data-Portals ist das Gesetz über offene Daten der Träger der öffentlichen Verwaltung (Offene-Daten-Gesetz - ODaG) . Dort wird in §4 der Betrieb des Open-Data-Portals geregelt.

Umfang der Daten
Im schleswig-holsteinischen Open-Data-Portal sind zunächst die Daten der landeseigenen Verwaltung und kommunaler Piloten vorhanden. Mittelfristig werden möglichst viele Datensätze mit Bezug zu Schleswig-Holstein über die Plattform abrufbar sein. Die Daten sind offen zugänglich und können frei genutzt, verarbeitet und verbreitet werden.

Maschineller Zugriff
Sie möchten automatisiert auf die Daten von Open Data Schleswig-Holstein zugreifen? Erfahren Sie in unserer Entwicklerdokumentation, auf welche Weise dies möglich ist.

Bereitstellen von Informationen
Im Open-Data-Portal Schleswig-Holstein können Landesbehörden, Kommunen, Unternehmen sowie andere Organisationen (juristische Personen) Daten veröffentlichen. Eine Veröffentlichung durch Einzelpersonen ist nicht möglich. Erste Informationen über das Bereitstellen von Daten liefert der Open-Data-Leitfaden Schleswig-Holstein, der als Webseite und als PDF-Dokument verfügbar ist.

Kontakt
Bei Fragen und Anregungen helfen wir Ihnen gerne weiter. Sie erreichen uns per E-Mail unter opendata@lr.landsh.de oder über das Kontaktformular.

You can analyze and combine datasets using maps, as well as develop new web and mobile applications. Let's achieve our goals together.

properties.name: slavutsk-city-council-open-data-portal
properties.title: Slavutsk City Council Open Data Portal
properties.description:
In accordance with the Law of Ukraine "On Access to Public Information," public information in the form of open data (open data) is published for free and unrestricted access. Open data is permitted for its further free use and dissemination. Any person may freely copy, publish, distribute, use, including for commercial purposes, in combination with other information or by including open data in their own product, with mandatory reference to the source of its receipt. A condition of any further use of open data is the mandatory reference to the source of its receipt (including a hyperlink to the web page of the open data of the information manager). Proposals for the publication of new datasets, improvement of existing datasets, as well as information about developed services or visualizations using data from the Portal should be sent to the portal administrator: opendata@slavuta-mvk.gov.ua

*Translated from Ukrainian*

---

**Original Text:**
Відповідно до Закону України "Про доступ до публічної інформації” публічна інформація у формі відкритих даних (відкриті дані) оприлюднюється для вільного та безоплатного доступу до неї. Відкриті дані дозволені для їх подальшого вільного використання та поширення. Будь-яка особа може вільно копіювати, публікувати, поширювати, використовувати, зокрема в комерційних цілях, у поєднанні з іншою інформацією або шляхом включення до складу власного продукту відкриті дані з обов’язковим посиланням на джерело їх отримання. Умовою будь-якого подальшого використання відкритих даних є обов’язкове посилання на джерело їх отримання (у тому числі гіперпосилання на веб-сторінку відкритих даних розпорядника інформації). Пропозиції щодо оприлюднення нових наборів даних, вдосконалення існуючих наборів, а також інформацію про розроблені сервіси чи візуалізації з використанням даних з Порталу прохання надсилати адміністратору порталу: opendata@slavuta-mvk.gov.ua

properties.name: open-data-solok-selatan
properties.title: Open Data Solok Selatan
properties.description:
ONE DATA INFORMATION SYSTEM (SISTA) OF SOLOK SELATAN REGENCY

Legal Basis:
1. Presidential Regulation (Perpres) Number 39 of 2019 concerning One Data Indonesia
2. Regent Regulation of Solok Selatan Number 24 of 2022 concerning the Implementation of One Data Indonesia in Solok Selatan Regency

Macro Issues:
1. Technology Infrastructure: This issue includes the availability of adequate IT infrastructure, including fast and stable internet connectivity, as well as the need for secure and well-managed data storage.
2. Policies and Regulations: The absence of clear policies or adequate regulations in the management and protection of data can be a serious obstacle. This includes policies related to data privacy and protection against cyber attacks.
3. Funding and Resources: Lack of funding for investment in information technology, human resource training, and data management can hinder progress in effective data management.
4. Data Quality: This issue includes inconsistent or inaccurate data quality, which can reduce the usefulness of data for effective decision making.
5. Public Awareness and Engagement: Lack of public awareness of the importance of data or low engagement in data collection can reduce the quality and quantity of data available.

Micro Issues:
1. Data Management at the Local Level: Challenges in collecting, processing, and reporting data at the local or sub-district level, which may not have sufficient capacity or resources.
2. Data Integration Between Sectors: Difficulties in integrating data from various sectors such as education, health, economics, and others, making it difficult to obtain a comprehensive picture.
3. Qualification and Training of Human Resources: Lack of qualifications or training in data analysis and information technology can be an obstacle to effective data management.
4. Data Security and Privacy: Risks to data security and privacy that may be threatened by a lack of adequate security infrastructure or low awareness of data security.
5. Limited Access to Technology: Challenges in accessing information technology, especially in rural or remote areas, which can hinder effective data collection and distribution.

Strategic Issues:
1. Availability of Integrated Data: It is important to ensure that existing data from various sectors (e.g., education, health, economy, social) is available in an integrated manner. This allows for holistic analysis and better decision making.
2. Data Security: Protecting the public's personal and sensitive data is very important. It is necessary to have strict policies regarding data security, including protection against data leaks and cyber attacks.
3. Information Technology Infrastructure: Ensuring adequate IT infrastructure is key to effective data management. This includes fast and stable internet connectivity, as well as secure data storage.
4. Data Accessibility and Openness: Facilitating public access to data is important for government transparency and public participation. Solok Selatan can consider developing a platform or portal to facilitate data access for the public.

Renewal Method:
Before the existence of the One Data Information System (SISTA) of Solok Selatan Regency, government or data users who needed data had to come directly to the Department of Communication and Informatics of Solok Selatan Regency, the Regional Apparatus Organizations (OPD) that produce data, and the Central Statistics Agency of Solok Selatan Regency. After the existence of the One Data Information System (SISTA) of Solok Selatan Regency, the government or data users who need data can obtain data directly by accessing the website of the One Data Information System (SISTA) of Solok Selatan Regency. At the beginning of the implementation, this innovation was named the One Data Information System (SISTA) of Solok Selatan Regency. Over time, this innovation has undergone system development/renewal, so that currently the SISTA innovation has changed its name to "OPEN DATA of Solok Selatan Regency," which has been integrated with the One Data Portal of West Sumatra and the One Data Portal of Indonesia.

Advantages:
1. Access to information can be done without having to go to the OPD (Data Producer) or the Central Statistics Agency of Solok Selatan Regency.
2. Public Information Applicants can make information requests at any time by accessing the website of the One Data Information System (SISTA) of Solok Selatan Regency.

*Translated from Indonesian*

---

**Original Text:**
SISTEM INFORMASI SATU DATA (SISTA) KABUPATEN SOLOK SELATAN Dasar Hukum 1. Peraturan Presiden (Perpres) Nomor 39 Tahun 2019 tentang Satu Data Indonesia 2. Peraturan Bupati Solok Selatan Nomor 24 Tahun 2022 tentang Penyelenggaraan Satu Data Indonesia di Kabupaten Solok Selatan Permasalahan Makro : 1. Infrastruktur Teknologi : Masalah ini mencakup ketersediaan infrastruktur IT yang memadai, termasuk konektivitas internet yang cepat dan stabil, serta kebutuhan akan penyimpanan data yang aman dan terkelola dengan baik. 2. Kebijakan dan Regulasi : Tidak adanya kebijakan yang jelas atau regulasi yang memadai dalam pengelolaan dan perlindungan data dapat menjadi hambatan serius. Hal ini termasuk kebijakan terkait privasi data dan perlindungan terhadap serangan siber. 3. Pendanaan dan Sumber Daya : Kurangnya pendanaan untuk investasi dalam teknologi informasi, pelatihan sumber daya manusia, dan pengelolaan data dapat menghambat kemajuan dalam pengelolaan data yang efektif. 4. Kualitas Data : Masalah ini mencakup kualitas data yang tidak konsisten atau tidak akurat, yang dapat mengurangi kegunaan data untuk pengambilan keputusan yang efektif. 5. Kesadaran dan Keterlibatan Masyarakat : Kurangnya kesadaran masyarakat akan pentingnya data atau keterlibatan yang rendah dalam pengumpulan data dapat mengurangi kualitas dan kuantitas data yang tersedia. Permasalahan Mikro : 1. Pengelolaan Data di Tingkat Lokal : Tantangan dalam pengumpulan, pengolahan, dan pelaporan data di tingkat lokal atau kecamatan yang mungkin tidak memiliki kapasitas atau sumber daya yang cukup. 2. Integrasi Data Antar Sektor : Kesulitan dalam mengintegrasikan data dari berbagai sektor seperti pendidikan, kesehatan, ekonomi, dan lainnya sehingga sulit untuk mendapatkan gambaran yang komprehensif. 3. Kualifikasi dan Pelatihan Sumber Daya Manusia : Kurangnya kualifikasi atau pelatihan dalam analisis data dan teknologi informasi dapat menjadi hambatan dalam pengelolaan data yang efektif. 4. Keamanan dan Privasi Data : Risiko terhadap keamanan dan privasi data yang mungkin terancam oleh kurangnya infrastruktur keamanan yang memadai atau kesadaran yang rendah tentang keamanan data. 5. Keterbatasan Akses Teknologi : Tantangan akses terhadap teknologi informasi, terutama di daerah pedesaan atau terpencil, yang dapat menghambat pengumpulan dan distribusi data yang efektif. Isu Strategis 1. Ketersediaan Data yang Terintegrasi : Penting untuk memastikan bahwa data yang ada dari berbagai sektor (misalnya pendidikan, kesehatan, ekonomi, sosial) tersedia secara terintegrasi. Hal ini memungkinkan untuk analisis yang holistik dan pengambilan keputusan yang lebih baik. 2. Keamanan Data : Melindungi data pribadi dan sensitif masyarakat sangat penting. Perlu memiliki kebijakan yang ketat terkait keamanan data, termasuk perlindungan terhadap kebocoran data dan serangan siber. 3. Infrastruktur Teknologi Informasi : Memastikan infrastruktur IT yang memadai adalah kunci dalam pengelolaan data yang efektif. Hal ini mencakup konektivitas internet yang cepat dan stabil, serta penyimpanan data yang aman. 4. Aksesibilitas dan Keterbukaan Data : Memfasilitasi akses publik terhadap data yang penting untuk transparansi pemerintahan dan partisipasi masyarakat. Solok Selatan dapat mempertimbangkan untuk mengembangkan platform atau portal untuk memudahkan akses data bagi publik. Metode Pembaharuan Sebelum adanya Sistem Informasi Satu Data (SISTA) Kabupaten Solok Selatan pemerintah atau pengguna data yang memerlukan data harus datang langsung ke Dinas Komunikasi dan Informatika Kabupaten Solok Selatan, OPD yang menghasilkan data dan Badan Pusat Statistik Kabupaten Solok Selatan. Setelah adanya Sistem Informasi Satu Data (SISTA) Kabupaten Solok Selatan maka pemerintah atau pengguna data yang memerlukan bisa mendapatkan data secara langsung dengan cara mengakses website Sistem Informasi Satu Data (SISTA) Kabupaten Solok Selatan Pada saat awal penerapan Inovasi ini bernama Sistem Informasi Satu Data (SISTA) Kabupaten Solok Selatan, seiring dengan berjalannya waktu, inovasi ini telah dilakukan perkembangan/pembaharuan sistem sehingga saat ini inovasi SISTA berubah nama menjadi "OPEN DATA Kabupaten Solok Selatan" yang telah terintegrasi dengan Portal Satu Data Sumatera Barat dan Portal Satu Data Indonesia Keunggulan 1. Akses Informasi bisa dilakukan tanpa harus mendatangi OPD (Produsen Data) atau ke Badan Pusat Statistik Kabupaten Solok Selatan 2. Pemohon Informasi Publik bisa melakukan permintaan informasi setiap waktu dengan cara mengakses website Sistem Informasi Satu Data (SISTA) Kabupaten Solok Selatan

properties.name: swiss-open-data-portal
properties.title: Swiss Open Data Portal
properties.description:
opendata.swiss is the central portal for open, i.e., freely accessible data from Swiss authorities (Open Government Data, OGD). The opendata.swiss portal provides users with simple and secure central access to open data from the Confederation, cantons, and municipalities. If there is a public interest, data from third parties – federal-affiliated companies and private actors commissioned by federal, cantonal, or municipal authorities – will also be published, even if they are already available on other portals. opendata.swiss is primarily intended to: The portal only contains a catalog of the available data, which is managed by the providers themselves. This avoids duplication. In general, no personal data is published within the framework of OGD. This involves aggregated and anonymized data that does not allow any conclusions to be drawn about individuals. This condition is mandatory and must be adhered to by the data providers. Would you like to publish data on opendata.swiss? Interested providers of public data can find further details in the corresponding handbook under the following link: handbook.opendata.swiss. Who manages the portal? The Open Government Data Office, which is located at the FSO, manages the portal. It supports organizations in the publication of their open data and continuously monitors the quality of the catalog. opendata.swiss was developed as part of the "Strategy for Open Government Data in Switzerland 2019–2023," which the Federal Council adopted on November 30, 2018. This strategic guideline is mandatory for the federal administration. Partner organizations: Until 2018, opendata.swiss was developed under the leadership of the Swiss Federal Archives (SFA) by various partner organizations. In 2019, the Federal Department of Home Affairs (FDHA) transferred responsibility to the Federal Statistical Office (FSO). The portal is continuously being developed in collaboration with the partner organizations. A list of all data providers is available. The following organizations support the OGD Office in the development and administration of the portal: Do you have any questions? Further information and documentation can be found on the website of the Federal Statistical Office (FSO). If you have questions about a specific dataset, please contact the contact point specified for the dataset directly. For general questions about the portal or the topic of public data, we are at your disposal.

*Translated from German*

---

**Original Text:**
opendata.swiss ist das zentrale Portal für offene, d.h. frei zugängliche Daten der Schweizer Behörden (Open Government Data, OGD). Das Portal opendata.swiss gewährleistet den Nutzerinnen und Nutzern einen einfachen und sicheren zentralen Zugang zu den offenen Daten von Bund, Kantonen und Gemeinden. Sofern ein öffentliches Interesse besteht, werden auch Daten von Dritten – bundesnahe Betriebe sowie von den Bundes-, Kantons- oder Gemeindebehörden beauftragte private Akteure – veröffentlicht, selbst wenn sie bereits auf anderen Portalen enthalten sind. opendata.swiss soll in erster Linie: Das Portal enthält lediglich einen Katalog der verfügbaren Daten, die jedoch von den Anbietern selber verwaltet werden. So lassen sich Doppelspurigkeiten vermeiden. Generell werden im Rahmen der OGD keine Personendaten publiziert. Es handelt sich um aggregierte und anonymisierte Daten, die keine Rückschlüsse auf Einzelpersonen zulassen. Diese Bedingung ist zwingend und muss von den Datenanbietern eingehalten werden. Möchten Sie Daten auf opendata.swiss publizieren? Interessierte Anbieter öffentlicher Daten finden weitere Einzelheiten im entsprechenden Handbuch unter folgendem Link: handbook.opendata.swiss. Wer verwaltet das Portal? Die Geschäftsstelle Open Government Data, die beim BFS angesiedelt ist, verwaltet das Portal. Sie unterstützt die Organisationen bei der Publikation ihrer offenen Daten und überwacht fortlaufend die Qualität des Katalogs. opendata.swiss wurde im Rahmen der «Strategie für offene Verwaltungsdaten in der Schweiz 2019–2023», die der Bundesrat am 30. November 2018 verabschiedet hat, entwickelt. Diese strategische Vorgabe ist für die Bundesverwaltung verpflichtend. Partnerorganisationen opendata.swiss wurde bis 2018 unter der Federführung des Schweizerischen Bundesarchivs (BAR) von verschiedenen Partnerorganisationen entwickelt. 2019 hat das Eidgenössische Departement des Innern (EDI) die Verantwortung an das Bundesamt für Statistik (BFS) übertragen. Das Portal wird in Zusammenarbeit mit den Partnerorganisationen laufend weiterentwickelt. Eine Liste aller Datenanbieter steht zur Verfügung. Die nachfolgenden Organisationen unterstützen die OGD-Geschäftsstelle bei der Entwicklung und Verwaltung des Portals: Haben Sie Fragen? Weitere Informationen sowie die Dokumentation finden Sie auf der Website des Bundesamtes für Statistik (BFS). Wenn Sie Fragen zu einem spezifischen Datensatz haben, wenden Sie sich bitte direkt an die für den Datensatz angegebene Kontaktstelle. Bei allgemeinen Fragen zum Portal oder zum Thema öffentliche Daten stehen wir gerne zu Ihrer Verfügung.

properties.name: thai-industrial-standards-institute
properties.title: Thai Industrial Standards Institute (TISI)
properties.description:
The Thai Industrial Standards Institute (TISI) has a mission regarding the operation of the country's standardization, by establishing, inspecting, and certifying industrial product standards, community product standards, standards related to inspection and certification, and other standards as assigned. It controls, promotes, supports, and develops industrial products and community products to be accepted in order to enhance the competitiveness of Thai industries in the global market, protect the environment, and protect consumers to receive fairness, safety in life and property, including supervising inspection and certification bodies to comply with the law. It has the following duties and powers: Vision, Duties and Powers: (1) To proceed in accordance with the Industrial Product Standards Act, the National Standardization Act, and other related laws. (2) To propose policies, guidelines, and measures to promote and develop the country's standardization, as well as to develop the standardization infrastructure. (3) To promote, support, supervise, and implement the establishment of standards, inspection and certification, and control the use of standard marks. (4) To promote, support, supervise, and provide services related to the accreditation of standardization systems, as well as the country's standardization, to ensure unity and acceptance. (5) To promote and develop organizations and personnel in both the public and private sectors in the field of standardization. (6) To cooperate and coordinate with relevant organizations and agencies, both domestically, internationally, and internationally, in the field of standardization, including making related standardization agreements. (7) To manage information and data related to standardization. (8) To perform any other actions as stipulated by law to be the duties and powers of the Office or as assigned by the Minister or the Cabinet. The divisions of the Thai Industrial Standards Institute are as follows: (1) Office of the Secretary to the Director-General (2) Legal Division (3) Division of Standardization Organization Supervision (4) Standards Development Division (5) Standards Control Division (6) Standards Inspection Division 1 (7) Standards Inspection Division 2 (8) Standards Inspection Division 3 (9) Community Product Standards Administration Division (10) International Standards Administration Division (11) Strategy and Planning Division (12) Standardization Promotion and Development Division (13) Information and Communication Technology Center (14) Office of the National Standardization Committee.

*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
สํานักงานมาตรฐานผลิตภัณฑ์อุตสาหกรรมมีภารกิจเกี่ยวกับการดําเนินงานด้านการมาตรฐานของประเทศ โดยกําหนด ตรวจสอบและรับรองมาตรฐานผลิตภัณฑ์อุตสาหกรรมมาตรฐานผลิตภัณฑ์ชุมชน มาตรฐานที่เกี่ยวข้องกับการตรวจสอบและรับรอง และมาตรฐานอื่นตามที่ได้รับมอบหมาย ควบคุม ส่งเสริม สนับสนุน และพัฒนาผลิตภัณฑ์อุตสาหกรรมและผลิตภัณฑ์ชุมชนให้เป็นที่ยอมรับเพื่อเพิ่มขีดความสามารถในการแข่งขันของอุตสาหกรรมไทยในตลาดโลก พิทักษ์สิ่งแวดล้อมและคุ้มครองผู้บริโภคให้ได้รับความเป็นธรรม มีความปลอดภัยในชีวิตและทรัพย์สิน รวมทั้งการกํากับดูแลหน่วยตรวจสอบและรับรองให้เป็นไปตามกฎหมาย โดยให้มีหน้าที่และอํานาจ ดังต่อไปนี้ วิสัยทัศน์ อำนาจหน้าที่ (๑) ดําเนินการตามกฎหมายว่าด้วยมาตรฐานผลิตภัณฑ์อุตสาหกรรม กฎหมายว่าด้วยการมาตรฐานแห่งชาติ และกฎหมายอื่นที่เกี่ยวข้อง (๒) เสนอแนะนโยบาย แนวทาง และมาตรการในการส่งเสริมและพัฒนาด้านการมาตรฐานของประเทศตลอดจนพัฒนาโครงสร้างพื้นฐานด้านการมาตรฐาน (๓) ส่งเสริม สนับสนุน กํากับดูแล และดําเนินการกําหนดมาตรฐาน ตรวจสอบและรับรองและควบคุมการใช้เครื่องหมายมาตรฐาน (๔) ส่งเสริม สนับสนุน กํากับดูแล และให้บริการเกี่ยวกับการรับรองระบบงานด้านการมาตรฐานตลอดจนการมาตรฐานของประเทศให้เกิดความเป็นเอกภาพและเป็นที่ยอมรับ (๕) ส่งเสริมและพัฒนาองค์กรและบุคลากรทั้งภาครัฐและเอกชนในด้านการมาตรฐาน (๖) ร่วมมือและประสานงานกับองค์การและหน่วยงานที่เกี่ยวข้องทั้งในประเทศ ต่างประเทศ และระหว่างประเทศในด้านการมาตรฐาน รวมทั้งการทําความตกลงด้านการมาตรฐานที่เกี่ยวข้อง (๗) ดําเนินการเกี่ยวกับข้อมูลและสารสนเทศด้านการมาตรฐาน (๘) ปฏิบัติการอื่นใดตามที่กฎหมายกําหนดให้เป็นหน้าที่และอํานาจของสํานักงานหรือตามที่ รัฐมนตรีหรือคณะรัฐมนตรีมอบหมาย การแบ่งส่วนราชการสํานักงานมาตรฐานผลิตภัณฑ์อุตสาหกรรม ดังต่อไปนี้ (๑) สํานักงานเลขานุการกรม (๒) กองกฎหมาย (๓) กองกํากับองค์กรด้านการมาตรฐาน (๔) กองกําหนดมาตรฐาน (๕) กองควบคุมมาตรฐาน (๖) กองตรวจการมาตรฐาน ๑ (๗) กองตรวจการมาตรฐาน ๒ (๘) กองตรวจการมาตรฐาน ๓ (๙) กองบริหารมาตรฐานผลิตภัณฑ์ชุมชน (๑๐) กองบริหารมาตรฐานระหว่างประเทศ (๑๑) กองยุทธศาสตร์และแผนงาน (๑๒) กองส่งเสริมและพัฒนาด้านการมาตรฐาน (๑๓) ศูนย์เทคโนโลยีสารสนเทศและการสื่อสาร (๑๔) สํานักงานคณะกรรมการการมาตรฐานแห่งชาติ

properties.name: transport-open-data-home-page-transport-open-data
properties.title: Transport Open Data Home Page | Transport Open Data
properties.description: The Open Data Hub is the central location for all Transport for NSW open data. The Open Data Hub was established in April 2016 at the Future Transport summit and replaced the Transport Data Exchange (TDX) Program. Since the launch of the Hub we have welcomed more than 35,700+ registered users who have created 9000+ applications via the Open Data Hub. Browse our data catalogue to explore our available APIs, downloadable datasets, interactive maps and insights. The Open Data Hub now hosts over 200 datasets with over 1000 resources (APIs, files and other documents) and counting. Use topics, tags and formats to narrow down to your interest area. If you are interested in geospatial in particular, check out our datasets with geospatial resources. The maps are interactive allowing you to search, filter, zoom in/out. Maps data is downloadable as geospatial files resources within the same dataset. For visualisations and insights on transport related matters, you can go directly by selecting Browse Insights. Transport Open Data is sourced by many developers to feed reference or real time data into their apps which service millions of NSW citizens. To support developers getting started on using Transport Open Data, we have compiled under Developers section a collection of useful resources including step-by-step user guide, documentation, and developer information. Transport Open Data team works and collaborates continuously with various Transport teams and partners to enhance and enrich its platform, its features, data & insights available. See our Data Stories to find out some examples of how we are leveraging Transport data to provide passengers and communities with up to date and real time information Each year we run multiple Innovation Challenges, aimed at encouraging finding new ways of using data, innovation in the NSW transport sector and improving the customer experience across all transport modes in NSW. Head over to our Innovation Challenges page to view current and past challenges. Data collaborations and partnerships play an important role in enabling improvements or new ways of using Transport data, with significant positive outcomes for Transport passengers and NSW communities, in line with Transport strategies. Through co-design, co-create or data exchange with other government, research, education or industry organisations we leverage partners’ expertise and resources, enable whole of government outcomes, improve transport outcomes across the sector, all for the benefit of people of NSW. The Open Data Forum is the place to go to seek advice from our community of developers and TfNSW staff who are on hand to help. You can ask questions, discuss ideas, brag about your latest creation, or simply browse posts from a wide range of categories.

properties.name: university-of-granada-open-data
properties.title: University of Granada Open Data
properties.description:
Open data and its content are those that can be freely used, modified, and shared by anyone for any purpose ([Open Knowledge Foundation](http://okfn.es/)). At the University of Granada, we want to promote the reuse of public information, in a way that generates additional value for citizens by providing transparency and greater citizen participation through the exposure of data generated by the university. The University of Granada has enabled this portal so that the general public and members of the university in particular (Administrative and Service Staff, Teaching and Research Staff, and students) have access to the main data related to the activity of this university in an accessible, reusable, and shareable format. In the University of Granada's open data portal, you will find the data generated by the university (academic, research, services, budgets, etc.) in a format and with a license suitable for you to access, analyze, reuse, and share them. The exploitation of data generated by the public institution can be used by the private sector and citizens to generate additional value by building new services and applications with the data, conducting studies and analyses, or imagining new innovative uses of this data. Tools, apps, reports, analyses, studies, articles... Think, use, and help us create a catalog of applications with the data from the University of Granada. Tim Berners-Lee, inventor of the web and initiator of "Linked Data," defined a quality model to measure the reusability of open data, known as the five-star open data model (5 - star Open Data). This model establishes five levels of quality labeled with stars according to their suitability for the purpose of being reused. You can consult this model at [5 Star Data](http://5stardata.info). This portal is maintained by the Free Software Office of the University of Granada. For any questions, you can write to us at the email address [opendata@ugr.es](opendata.ugr.es) or through our [Twitter] (https://twitter.com/DatosUGR) account.

*Translated from Spanish*

---

**Original Text:**
Los datos abiertos y su contenido son aquellos que pueden ser libremente utilizados, modificados y compartidos por cualquier persona para cualquier propósito ([Open Knowledge Foundation] (http://okfn.es/)). Desde la Universidad de Granada queremos impulsar la reutilización de la información pública, de manera que genere un valor adicional para la ciudadanía aportando transparencia y mayor participación ciudadana a través de la exposición de los datos generados desde la universidad. La Universidad de Granada ha habilitado este portal para que el público en general y los miembros de la universidad en particular (PAS, PDI y estudiantes) tengan acceso a los principales datos relacionados con la actividad de esta universidad en un formato accesible, reutilizable y compartible. En el portal de datos abiertos de la Universidad de Granada encontrarás los datos que genera la universidad (académicos, investigación, servicios, presupuestos, etc. ) en un formato y con una licencia adecuados para que puedas acceder a ellos, analizarlos, reutilizarlos y compartirlos. La explotación de los datos generados por la institución pública puede ser utilizado por el sector privado y la ciudadanía para generar un valor adicional construyendo con los datos nuevos servicios y aplicaciones, realizando estudios y análisis o imaginando nuevos usos innovadores de estos datos. Herramientas, apps, informes, análisis, estudios, artículos... Piensa, usa y ayúdanos a crear un catálogo de aplicaciones con los datos de la Universidad de Granada. Tim Berners-Lee, inventor de la web e iniciador del “Linked Data”, definió un modelo de calidad para medir la capacidad de reutilización de los datos abiertos, conocido como el modelo de cinco estrellas de los datos abiertos (5 - star Open Data). Este modelo establece cinco niveles de calidad etiquetados con estrellas según su adecuación al objetivo de ser reutilizados. Puedes consultar este modelo en [5 Star Data] (http://5stardata.info). Este portal está mantenido por la Oficina de Sofware Libre de la Universidad de Granada. Para cualquier consulta puedes escribirnos al correo electrónico [opendata@ugr.es] (opendata.ugr.es) o a través de nuestra cuenta de [Twitter] (https://twitter.com/DatosUGR).

properties.name: university-of-bari
properties.title: University Of Bari
properties.description:
The first datasets of the University of Bari in OpenData format are online, and this process will continue in the coming months with the aim of increasing the University's transparency, improving data accessibility, and supporting Open Government policies. The portal was developed and is managed by the Data Engineering Section of the University of Bari. A heartfelt thank you to @Piersoft for the valuable advice. The first datasets of the University of Bari in OpenData format are available for download and re-use of this site and the number will grow in the coming months with the aim of increasing the transparency of the University, improving data accessibility and supporting Open Government policies. The portal was developed and is managed by Data Engineering Staff of the University of Bari . Thanks to @Piersoft for the valuable advice. For information or requests to publish data not yet available, contact db.staff@uniba.it (Data Engineering Staff). CKAN is the world's leading open-source data portal platform. CKAN is used by governments and user groups around the world to manage a vast array of data portals from official and community entities, including portals for local, national, and international governments, such as data.gov.uk in the United Kingdom and publicdata.eu of the European Union, dados.gov.br in Brazil, government portals of the Netherlands and the Dutch, as well as city and municipal administration sites in the USA, the United Kingdom, Argentina, Finland, and other countries. CKAN: http://ckan.org/ CKAN Tour: http://ckan.org/tour/ Features Overview: http://ckan.org/features/

*Translated from Italian*

---

**Original Text:**
I primi dataset dell'Università di Bari in formato OpenData sono online e il percorso proseguirà nei prossimi mesi con l'obiettivo di aumentare la trasparenza dell'Ateneo, migliorare l'accessibilità dei dati e dare supporto alle politiche di Open Government. Il portale è stato sviluppato ed è gestito dalla Sezione Data Engineering dell'Università di Bari. Un sentito ringraziamento a @Piersoft per le preziose consulenze. The first datasets of the University of Bari in OpenData format are available for download and re-use of this site and the number will grow in the coming months with the aim of increasing the transparency of the University, improving data accessibility and supporting Open Government policies. The portal was developed and is managed by Data Engineering Staff of the University of Bari . Thanks to @Piersoft for the valuable advice. Per informazioni o richieste di pubblicazione di dati non ancora disponibili contattare db.staff@uniba.it (Staff Data Engineering). CKAN è la piattaforma leader mondiale per i portali di dati open-source. CKAN è usato da governi e gruppi di utenti in tutto il mondo per gestire una vasta serie di portali di dati di enti ufficiali e di comunità, tra cui portali per governi locali, nazionali e internazionali, come data.gov.uk nel Regno Unito e publicdata.eu dell'Unione Europea, dados.gov.br in Brasile, portali di governo dell'Olanda e dei Paesi Bassi, oltre a siti di amministrazione cittadine e municipali negli USA, nel Regno Unito, Argentina, Finlandia e altri paesi. CKAN: http://ckan.org/ Tour di CKAN: http://ckan.org/tour/ Panoramica delle funzioni: http://ckan.org/features/

With over 130 years of experience and history, we move Nuremberg and the region.
