properties.name: suomi-fi-service-interconnection-catalog
properties.title: Suomi.fi Service Interconnection Catalog
properties.description:
The Connection Catalogue is a service directory that presents the organizations connected to the Suomi.fi service gateway and the services they offer through the service gateway. The Suomi.fi service gateway is a uniform and secure data transfer solution that enables organizations to conduct electronic transactions. You can find more information about the Suomi.fi service gateway on the Service Gateway website .

In the connection catalog you will find descriptions of services, technical information and contact information for service providers. This means you can easily see which interface services are available through the Service Gateway and who maintains them. You can browse the connection catalog without registering.

When you find a service that interests your organization in the Access Catalog, you can agree on its implementation with the service provider. The implementation of services requires joining the Service Gateway. You register for the Access Catalog when joining the Service Gateway. Read more about the implementation of the Service Gateway on the Service Gateway website .

The Suomi.fi service gateway and the Connection Catalogue are produced by  the Finnish Digital and Population Information Agency .

properties.name: manaaki-whenua-landcare-research-datastore
properties.title: Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research DataStore
properties.description: The Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research DataStore ('the DataStore') is the general data catalogue and repository for Environmental Research Data from Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research NZ. Much of Manaaki Whenua’s research data is available through specific web pages, but many datasets sit outside these areas. This repository provides a mechanism for our staff to deposit and document this wider range of datasets so that they may be discovered and potentially re-used. The repository uses the open source CKAN data portal software. Reference the DataStore in general using the DOI https://doi.org/10.7931/mwlr.datastore. By using this site you agree to the Terms of Use Email: Data Management https://www.landcareresearch.co.nz

properties.name: girona-open-data
properties.title: Girona Open Data
properties.description:

properties.name: sagamihara-city-open-data-catalog-site
properties.title: Sagamihara City Open Data Catalog Site
properties.description:
This site is a catalog site for publishing open data from Sagamihara City, Kanagawa Prefecture. It publishes data held by the government in a data format that anyone can reuse. By promoting open data, improvements in administrative transparency and reliability, improved convenience for citizens, and revitalization of the local economy are expected. CKAN is the world's leading open-source data portal platform. CKAN is a complete, out-of-the-box software solution to make data accessible and usable. It provides tools to streamline the publishing, sharing, finding, and use of data (including data storage and robust data APIs). CKAN is built for data publishers (national and local governments, companies, and organizations) who want to open up and publish their data. CKAN is used by governments and user groups around the world. It powers a variety of public or community data portals, including local, national, and international administrations, such as data.gov.uk in the UK, publicdata.eu in the EU, dados.gov.br in Brazil, the Dutch government portal, and local governments in the US, UK, Argentina, and Finland.
CKAN: http://ckan.org/
CKAN Tour: http://ckan.org/tour/
Features: http://ckan.org/features/

*Translated from Japanese*

---

**Original Text:**
本サイトは、神奈川県相模原市のオープンデータを公開するカタログサイトです。 行政が保有するデータを、誰もが二次利用が可能なデータ形式で公開することです。 オープンデータを推進することにより、行政の透明性・信頼性の向上、市民の利便性向上、地域経済の活性化などが期待されます。 CKANは世界をリードするオープンソースのデータポータルプラットホームです。 CKANはデータをアクセス可能で使用可能にするための完全に枠を超えたソフトウェアソリューションです。データをストリームラインで公開、共有、発見、使用するためのツールを提供しています(データストレージや頑強なデータAPIの提供も含みます)。CKANはデータをオープンにして公開したいと思っているデータ公開者(国や地方行政、会社や組織)のために作られています。 CKANは世界中の行政やユーザグループによって使用されています。イギリスの data.gov.uk、EUの publicdata.eu、ブラジルの dados.gov.br、オランダの政府ポータル、US、UK、アルゼンチン、フィンランド等の地方自治体のように、地方、国、国際的な行政を含む、様々な公的あるいはコミュニティのデータポータルの力となっています。 CKAN: http://ckan.org/ CKAN ツアー: http://ckan.org/tour/ 特徴: http://ckan.org/features/

properties.name: natal-urban-mobility-data-portal
properties.title: Natal Urban Mobility Data Portal
properties.description:
This portal, from the Natal Urban Mobility Secretariat (STTU), aims to provide the public with access to the city's urban mobility data, whether through open data files or public software services. According to the Open Knowledge Foundation (OKF), "data is open when anyone can freely use, reuse, and redistribute it, subject only, at most, to the requirement to attribute authorship and share under the same license." In the context of the Brazilian government, Article 8 of Law 12.527/2011 (Access to Information Law – LAI) establishes that information of collective or general interest must be compulsorily disclosed by public bodies and entities on their official websites, which must meet, among other things, the following requirements: In line with the Access to Information Law and "Open Data" initiatives, the STTU launches its Natal Urban Mobility Transparency Portal, providing information and data channels through the areas of Static Data, Dynamic Data - Developer Area, and Public Software Services.

*Translated from Portuguese*

---

**Original Text:**
Esse portal, da Secretaria da Mobilidade Urbana de Natal (STTU), tem por objetivo fornecer à população acesso aos dados da mobilidade urbana da cidade, seja através de arquivos de dados abertos, seja através de serviços públicos de software. Segundo a Fundação do Conhecimento Aberto (Open Knowledge Foundation – OKF), “dados são abertos quando qualquer pessoa pode livremente usá-los, reutilizá-los e redistribuí-los, estando sujeito a, no máximo, a exigência de creditar a sua autoria e compartilhar pela mesma licença”. No contexto do governo brasileiro, o art. 8º da Lei 12.527/2011 (Lei de Acesso à Informação – LAI) estabelece que as informações de interesse coletivo ou geral devem ser obrigatoriamente divulgadas pelos órgãos e entidades públicos em seus sítios oficiais, os quais devem atender, entre outros, aos seguintes requisitos: Em sintonia com a Lei de Acesso a Informação e com as iniciativas de "Open Data", a STTU lança seu Portal da Transparência da Mobilidade Urbana de Natal, disponibilizando canais de informação e de dados, através das áreas de Dados Estáticos, Dados Dinâmicos - Área do Desenvolvedor e Serviços Públicos de Software.

properties.name: buenos-aires-justice-data
properties.title: Buenos Aires Justice Data

This site provides transparency data from the Superior Court of Justice of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires. The Court grants access to the information it generates through the publication of datasets and documents in open format. This guarantees the right of access to information and promotes the use and reuse of data.

*Translated from Spanish*

---

**Original Text:**
Este sitio disponibiliza datos de transparencia del Tribunal de Justicia de la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires. El Tribunal brinda acceso a la información que genera con la publicación de conjuntos de datos y documentos en formato abierto. Se garantiza con ello el derecho de acceso a la información y se promueve el uso y reúso de los datos.

properties.name: ce-data-hub
properties.title: CE data hub
properties.description: DigiCirc is an innovation ecosystem that brings together companies public bodies and researchers to work towards making our economy more sustainable. To meet this ambition, DigiCirc promotes new digital technologies as useful tools to track and communicate the state, location and quality of materials, especially ones that are byproducts or waste. Supported by the European Union (Grant agreement number 873468), DigiCirc brings together a team of complementary partners from across Europe to organize three business acceleration programmes to support SME/startup innovation for the circular economy domain, helping them make use of digital technologies. We focus on 3 domains: The Circular economy data hub provides an interactive platform, where several types of heterogeneous open datasets from a wide range of sources on the 3 domains, are available. Datasets can be downloaded or they may be accessed through an API and a preview of the contents is available. For more information, please refer to the manual.

properties.name: dharmasraya-regency-data-portal
properties.title: Dharmasraya Regency Data Portal
properties.description:
Satu Data Indonesia (SDI), or One Data Indonesia, is a government data governance policy aimed at creating high-quality, easily accessible, and shareable data between Central and Regional Agencies. This policy is outlined in Presidential Regulation No. 39 of 2019 concerning Satu Data Indonesia. Through SDI, all government data and data from other related agencies can converge on the Satu Data Indonesia Portal (data.go.id). The Dharmasraya Regency Satu Data Indonesia Portal is the official regional open data portal managed by the Regional Satu Data Indonesia Secretariat, which consists of the Regional Development Planning, Research, and Innovation Agency (Bapperida), the Data Custodian at the Department of Communication and Informatics, and the role of the Dharmasraya Regency Central Bureau of Statistics as the Data Supervisor. Through this Satu Data Indonesia Portal, we are fully committed to improving data governance to achieve transparency and accountability in local government, as well as to support national and regional development. This website is the Satu Data Indonesia Portal, where the data displayed on the portal is generated by the regional government located in the Dharmasraya Regency through the Dharmasraya Regency Satu Data Indonesia Forum (SDI Forum). The SDI Forum was established by the Dharmasraya Regent Decree Number 188.45/219/KPTS-BUP/2022 concerning the Establishment of the Dharmasraya Regency Level Satu Data Indonesia Forum.

*Translated from Indonesian*

---

**Original Text:**
Satu Data Indonesia (SDI) merupakan kebijakan tata kelola data pemerintah yang bertujuan untuk menciptakan data berkualitas, mudah diakses, dan dapat dibagipakaikan antar Instansi Pusat serta Daerah. Kebijakan ini tertuang dalam Peraturan Presiden no. 39 tahun 2019 tentang Satu Data Indonesia. Melalui SDI, seluruh data pemerintah dan data instansi lain yang terkait dapat bermuara di Portal Satu Data Indonesia (data.go.id). Portal Satu Data Indonesia Kabupaten Dharmasraya merupakan portal resmi data terbuka tingkat daerah yang dikelola oleh Sekretariat Satu Data Indonesia tingkat Daerah yaitu Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan, Riset dan Inovasi Daerah (Bapperida), Walidata pada Dinas Komunikasi dan Informatika, serta adanya peran Badan Pusat Statistik Kabupaten Dharmasraya selaku Pembina Data. Melalui Portal Satu Data Indonesia ini kami berupaya penuh untuk memperbaiki tata kelola data demi terwujudnya transparansi dan akuntabilitas pemerintah daerah, serta mendukung pembangunan nasional dan daerah. Website ini adalah Portal Satu Data Indonesia, dimana data yang ditampilkan pada portal dihasilkan oleh pemerintahan daerah yang berada di wilayah Kabupaten Dharmasraya melalui Forum Satu Data Indonesia (Forum SDI) Kabupaten Dharmasraya. dimana Forum SDI tersebut telah ditetapkan melalui Keputusan Bupati Dharmasraya Nomor 188.45/219/KPTS-BUP/2022 tentang Pembentukan Foru Satu Data Indonesia Tingkat Kabupaten Dharmasraya

properties.name: onesqa-data-catalog
properties.title: ONESQA Data Catalog
properties.description:
The Government Data Catalog (GD Catalog) is a central repository of digital data assets from government agencies that have undergone a governance process and registered datasets for sharing and collaborative use of data from the originating data sources of each agency. Data is categorized for ready use, including forwarding to the open data service system, data.go.th, and the Government Data Exchange (GDX), as well as other platforms, to facilitate the shared use of government data. This aims to drive the country towards the goal of the well-being and happiness of the people.

*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
ระบบบัญชีข้อมูลกลางภาครัฐ (Government Data Catalog : GD Catalog) ระบบบัญชีข้อมูลภาครัฐเป็นศูนย์รวมบัญชีดิจิทัลของหน่วยงานภาครัฐที่ผ่านกระบวนการธรรมาภิบาลและลงทะเบียนชุดข้อมูลเพื่อการแบ่งปันและใช้ประโยชน์ร่วมกันของข้อมูลจากแหล่งข้อมูลต้นทางของหน่วยงาน โดยจัดหมวดหมู่ให้พร้อมใช้ รวมถึงส่งต่อไปยังระบบบริการข้อมูลเปิด data.go.th และศูนย์กลางแลกเปลี่ยนข้อมูลภาครัฐ (GDX) ตลอดจนแพลตฟอร์มอื่นๆ เพื่อประโยชน์ในการใช้ข้อมูลภาครัฐร่วมกัน เพื่อนำไปสู่การขับเคลื่อนประเทศไปสู่เป้าหมายความอยู่ดีมีสุขของประชาชน

properties.name: edge-open-data-portal
properties.title: EDGE Open Data Portal
properties.description:
The Durban EDGE is eThekwini Municipality’s platform to provide cutting-edge economic intelligence and insight to economic decision makers. The brand was established in 2011 by the City’s Economic Development Unit. The Durban EDGE produces publications; economic info releases, as well as on-demand seminars; an annual release on the State of the Durban Economy; and topical research papers.

Each release includes reliable data on the global, domestic, and local economy; designed to assist researchers, investors, business leaders, politicians and other key stakeholders. Anyone interested in receiving economic insights, participating in its activities, or contacting The Durban EDGE, is encouraged to email: edge@durban.gov.za

properties.name: activity-catalog-of-the-round-table-gis-association
properties.title: Activity Catalog Of The Round Table GIS Association
properties.description:
The efficient GIS network of research, business and administration
The Round Table GIS e.V. is one of the largest volunteer networks on the subject of geoinformation in Germany. The triangle of authorities, companies and science, in which the geoinformation industry usually moves, becomes a circle at the GIS Round Table, in which all participants can contribute their know-how and exchange their interests on an equal footing. The GIS Round Table thus promotes dialogue and cooperation whenever it comes to dealing with geospatial data and services and the special software solutions required for this.

*Translated from German*

---

**Original Text:**

Das effiziente GIS-Netzwerk von Forschung, Wirtschaft und Verwaltung
Der Runde Tisch GIS e.V. ist eines der größten ehrenamtlich organisierten Netzwerke zum Thema Geoinformation in Deutschland. Das Dreieck aus Behörden, Unternehmen und Wissenschaft, in dem sich die Geoinformationswirtschaft gewöhnlich bewegt, wird beim Runden Tisch GIS zum Kreis, in dem alle Beteiligten gleichberechtigt ihr Know-how einbringen und ihre Interessen austauschen können. Der Runde Tisch GIS fördert so den Dialog und die Kooperation, wann immer es um den Umgang mit raumbezogenen Daten und Diensten und den dafür notwendigen speziellen Softwarelösungen geht.

A data catalog site is a portal site that provides a data catalog (a directory or index of data). データカタログサイトとは、データカタログ（データの目録・索引）を提供するポータルサイトのことです。 メタデータ（データの属性・説明情報。具体的には、タイトル・URL・データ形式・作成者等）による検索が可能です。 現在公開しているデータは、統計情報や地理空間情報などが中心でまだまだデータ数が少ないですが、順次拡大していく予定です。

properties.name: integrated-ocean-observing-system-catalog
properties.title: Integrated Ocean Observing System Catalog
properties.description: The IOOS Catalog (https://data.ioos.us/) is an open data portal containing IOOS’ portfolio of oceanographic observations and forecast products provided by IOOS’ 11 Regional Associations (RAs), functional Data Assembly Centers (DACs) such as the HF Radar DAC and Glider DAC, and IOOS’ federal partners. The Catalog inventories all IOOS Data Management (DMAC)-compliant data access service endpoints provided by these entities in a single metadata repository, for discovery by end users. The Catalog is populated by ISO 19115 metadata records that describe the observations taken and forecast model outputs produced by the RAs and DACs using DMAC-recommended standard vocabularies and data formats wherever possible (netCDF-CF [1], ACDD [2]). The RAs and DACs publish their metadata to web accessible folders, or OGC CS-W services, and the Catalog harvests metadata from these locations on a daily basis. Because IOOS data provider metadata is often produced in an automated fashion by software reading native data file attributes (such as CF attribution in a netCDF file, for example), a daily automated harvest of the ISO XML metadata is necessary, in order to keep frequently varying information such as dataset time coverage current. The Catalog provides a searchable user graphical user interface (https://data.ioos.us/) for interactive data discovery by users, as well as a native API (https://data.ioos.us/api/3) and OGC CS-W (https://data.ioos.us/csw?service=CSW&request=GetCapabilities) -compatible service for machine-based access to its inventory of data products. Downstream national IOOS products such as the IOOS Environmental Sensor Map (https://sensors.ioos.us) use the Catalog inventory for real-time sensor observation services to include in its map portal. The IOOS Catalog is made up of three main components: the Data Catalog (the public user interface, based on CKAN open data catalog software) the Harvest Registry (an internal site used by data providers to manage metadata harvest sources) the Service Monitor (service uptime monitoring) Additional information about the IOOS Catalog and components, including instructions for IOOS data providers, can be found here: https://ioos.github.io/catalog. Catalog GitHub Repository: https://github.com/ioos/catalog. For information on project development timelines, Catalog source code, or to file an issue, please see the GitHub repo. The current faceted filtering options provided by the CKAN software underlying the Data Catalog are: Location (i.e. geographic bounding box), Organization (e.g. PacIOOS, GLOS, etc) Tags/keywords (e.g. sea_water_temperature, sea_water_electrical_conductivity) Formats (e.g. HTML, SOS, OPeNDAP, etc). Date and time Data providers There is also the option to do a free text search, which will search indexed metadata fields such as dataset title, abstract, keywords, and others and provide matched datasets. The datasets search page provides an option to search by start and/or end time. The CS-W service is provided by pycsw, a Python-based OGC Catalog Service software. It has its own internal search implementation that sometimes gives different results than CKAN’s embedded search, which is powered by the Apache Solr search indexing software. There is a long-term plan to abstract pycsw’s search implementation to allow external pluggable search implementations (including Solr) to interoperate with pycsw but this functionality is not yet available. Partially. The CI_RoleCode in ISO 19115 with a value of "originator" is used as the value of the data provider field. With development of standardized metadata profiles to represent this information in incoming metadata from the IOOS RAs and DACs, the CKAN catalog software could be extended to provide richer filtering options including concepts such as RA or platform operator. For more information on planned work on this, see: https://github.com/ioos/catalog/milestone/7. At the moment, there is not a straightforward technique for this. We hope to address this deficiency in the near future. As part of an upcoming development milestone (https://github.com/ioos/catalog/milestone/7), we will be investigating enhancements to both the CKAN software as well as developing metadata conventions to better enable our data providers to tag oceanographic forecast model output in a distinctive way that could then be represented in the Data Catalog interface to users. Also, the ability to filter data by time coverage should complement a forecast model tagging capability to search for data covering present time onward. Yes. Under the hood, CKAN uses Solr for search, and can accept Solr query strings in either the dataset search on the website or the package_search CKAN API endpoint. CF Standard Names are primarily provided by the `cf_standard_names` field. An example query is below: https://data.ioos.us/dataset?q=cf_standard_names:"sea_water_pressure" GCMD keywords work somewhat differently and are organized by hierarchy For example a query of https://data.ioos.us/dataset?q=gcmd_keywords:"Earth Science > Oceans > Ocean Chemistry > Chlorophyll" is equivalent to specifying the following values for gcmd_keywords: "EARTH SCIENCE > OCEANS > OCEAN CHEMISTRY > CHLOROPHYLL" "Earth Science>Oceans>Ocean Chemistry>Chlorophyll" "Earth Science > Oceans > Ocean Chemistry > Chlorophyll" The search is hierarchical and can also contain prefixes, i.e. https://data.ioos.us/dataset?q=gcmd_keywords:"Earth Science > Oceans" will find any GCMD keywords underneath it. If you want to search for a suffix with GCMD keywords, you will need to use a wildcard search: *Water\ Temperature' Note here the use of the escaped space per the Lucene query syntax. An example request to the CKAN API to query both GCMD Keywords starting with a value of "EARTH SCIENCE > OCEANS > OCEAN SCIENCE" and a CF standard name of "sea_water_electrical_conductivity" using cURL is below curl 'https://data.ioos.us/api/3/action/package_search?fq=gcmd_keywords:"EARTH+SCIENCE+>+OCEANS+>+OCEAN+TEMPERATURE"+cf_standard_names:"sea_water_electrical_conductivity"' An example request to the CKAN API to query both GCMD Keywords starting with a value of "EARTH SCIENCE > OCEANS > OCEAN SCIENCE" and a CF standard name of "sea_water_electrical_conductivity" using cURL is below References: [1]. Climate and Forecast Conventions: https://cfconventions.org/ [2]. Attribute Conventions for Dataset Discovery: https://wiki.esipfed.org/index.php/Attribute_Convention_for_Data_Discovery

properties.name: bc-data-catalogue
properties.title: BC Data Catalogue
properties.description:
BC Data Catalogue
The BC Data Catalogue is the place to find B.C. Government data, applications and web services. Government ministries and many broader public sector agencies publish their data resources in the Catalogue. The data in the catalogue can be used to make informed decisions and create opportunities for the benefit of all British Columbians.

The BC Data Catalogue is powered by CKAN and follows the ISO19115 standards. The B.C. Government participates in this software project, sharing developments with a community of international users

properties.name: faa-data-catalog
properties.title: FAA Data Catalog
properties.description: Catalog.Data.faa.gov was launched in 2020 and is managed and hosted by the Federal Aviation Administration, IT Shared Services organization - Chief Data Office. Catalog.Data.FAA.gov is powered by open source application CKAN. Catalog.Data.FAA.gov follows the DCAT-US Schema v1.1 (Project Open Data Metadata Schema) – a set of required fields (Title, Description, Tags, Last Update, Publisher, Contact Name, etc.) for every data set displayed on Catalog.Data.FAA.gov. Under the OPEN Government Data Act, which is Title II of the Foundations for Evidence-Based Policymaking Act, government data is required to be made available in open, machine-readable formats, while continuing to ensure privacy and security. FAA Data Stewards publish data thru the FAA Data Governance Center hosted and managed by the FAA Chief Data Office. Here the metadata is curated and validated for quality and accuracy. The FAA Data Steward enters metadata and verifies quality and accuracy before publishing to data.faa.gov. In accordance with data.gov guidelines, FAA has/does: You can search Catalog.Data.FAA.gov from its catalog of metadata from across the FAA Agency. Once in the catalog, to find datasets you can:

properties.name: national-housing-authority-data-catalog
properties.title: National Housing Authority Data Catalog (NHA)
properties.description:
The National Housing Authority is a state enterprise under the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security. It was established on February 12, 1973, according to the Revolutionary Council Announcement No. 316. It operates under the National Housing Authority Act B.E. 2537 (1994) and its Amendment (No. 2) B.E. 2550 (2007). Its objectives are to provide housing for people to have residences, along with providing infrastructure, public utilities, and facilities for residents. It also aims to maintain, improve, and develop the quality of life of residents in terms of social, economic, and environmental aspects; provide financial assistance to people who wish to have their own housing or who wish to participate in activities with the National Housing Authority in providing housing for people to rent, lease-purchase, or purchase; and engage in businesses related to the construction of buildings or land acquisition, renovation, demolition, or relocation of deteriorated areas to improve living conditions, environment, economy, and society. These are the objectives of the National Housing Authority.

*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
การเคหะแห่งชาติเป็นหน่วยงานรัฐวิสาหกิจ สังกัดกระทรวงการพัฒนาสังคมและความมั่นคงของมนุษย์ ก่อตั้งขึ้นเมื่อ วันที่ 12 กุมภาพันธ์ 2516 ตามประกาศคณะปฏิวัติ ฉบับที่ 316 ดำเนินงานภายใต้พระราชบัญญัติ การเคหะแห่งชาติ พ.ศ. 2537 และฉบับ แก้ไขเพิ่มเติม (ฉบับที่ 2) พ.ศ. 2550 มีวัตถุประสงค์เพื่อจัดให้มีเคหะ เพื่อให้ประชาชนได้มีที่อยู่อาศัย พร้อมทั้งจัดให้มีระบบ สาธารณูปโภค สาธารณูปการ สิ่งอำนวยความสะดวก แก่ผู้อยู่อาศัย ทำนุบำรุง ปรับปรุง และพัฒนาผู้อยู่อาศัยให้มีคุณภาพชีวิตที่ดีขึ้นทั้งทางสังคม เศรษฐกิจ และสิ่งแวดล้อม ให้ความช่วยเหลือทางการเงินแก่ประชาชนที่ประสงค์จะมีเคหะของตนเอง หรือผู้ที่ประสงค์จะร่วมดำเนินกิจกรรมกับการเคหะแห่งชาติในการจัดให้มีเคหะเพื่อให้ประชาชนเช่า เช่าซื้อ หรือซื้อ และประกอบธุรกิจเกี่ยวกับ การก่อสร้าง อาคารหรือจัดหาที่ดิน การปรับปรุง รื้อ หรือย้ายแหล่งเสื่อมโทรม เพื่อให้มีสภาพการอยู่อาศัย สิ่งแวดล้อม เศรษฐกิจ และสังคมที่ดีขึ้น วัตถุประสงค์การเคหะแห่งชาติ

properties.description: DASH Search is a centralized system for searching and discovering digital scientific assets across NCAR and UCAR Community Programs. Examples of digital assets available through the DASH Search system include but are not limited to datasets, publications (text, images, audio, video), software applications, and model codes. If you would like to make your assets discoverable through DASH Search, please use the DASH Search Request to Submit form.

properties.name: eu-language-technology-data
properties.title: EU Language Technology Data
properties.description:
The Danish Agency for Digitization collects and displays metadata about relevant Danish language resources as part of the joint public effort for Danish language technology. The political basis for sprogteknologi.dk can be found in the previous National Strategy for Artificial Intelligence from 2019, the Digitization Pact and the Economic Agreements for 2020 between the Government, KL  and Danish Regions , in which the establishment of a joint Danish language resource was adopted. Since then, the effort to strengthen Danish language technology has also been included in more recent political agreements, most recently in the Government's strategic effort for artificial intelligence from 2024.

The political anchoring of sprogteknologi.dk is in the 'Steering Group for Digital Innovation and Green Transition', which consists of a number of government authorities, the Danish Local Government and the Danish Regions. The Danish Agency for Digitalisation  is the secretariat for sprogteknologi.dk.The Danish Agency for Digitalisation's ambition is that solutions involving artificial intelligence should function just as well in a Danish context as in the context of the major languages. In this context, the Agency considers Danish language data to be a strategic resource that is necessary to ensure that artificial intelligence can be used in Denmark right now and in the future. Therefore, the Agency focuses on the work with language resources and not on the actual development of new language technology solutions or language models. 

The majority of language technology developed today is based on major languages, such as English, Chinese, Spanish, German and French, which is why language technology often lacks understanding and knowledge of the Danish language and Danish culture. Language technology is based on data that represents linguistic characteristics, cultural norms and values ​​and therefore has an impact on how the technology interprets input and how it responds. Lack of available Danish language resources makes it difficult or ineffective to use new technology in a Danish context.

properties.name: miyazaki-prefecture-statistics-data-catalog
properties.title: Miyazaki Prefecture Statistics Data Catalog (みやざき統計BOXデータカタログ)
properties.description:
The Miyazaki Statistics BOX Data Catalog is a website that widely publishes statistical information held by Miyazaki Prefecture as open data. Even if you do not know the name of a statistical survey, you can search for statistical data by organization, keyword, etc. We recommend using this tool in the following environment. * Please note that if you use the tool in an environment other than the recommended environment, or depending on your browser settings even within the recommended environment, it may not display correctly. This tool uses JavaScript. If JavaScript is disabled, some functions may not work properly or may not be displayed. Please enable JavaScript when using this tool. In order to understand the usage status, such as the number of users who have visited this site, and to utilize it for service improvement, we use Google Analytics to acquire users' browsing history information using cookies. The information collected using cookies does not include any information that can identify or distinguish individuals. User information collection is conducted based on Google's privacy policy. For information on Google Analytics' terms of service and privacy policy, please see the Google Analytics website. Users can choose to accept or reject cookies by changing their browser settings. If a user rejects cookies, they may experience certain functional limitations on specific pages.

Miyazaki Prefecture, General Policy Department, Statistics Survey Division
Phone number: 0985-26-7042
FAX number: 0985-29-0534
E-Mail: tokeichosa@pref.miyazaki.lg.jp

*Translated from Japanese*

---

properties.name: cioos-pacific-ocean-data-catalogue
properties.title: CIOOS Pacific Ocean Data Catalogue
properties.description:
CIOOS
The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) [sea-use] is a national online platform to make ocean data openly discoverable and accessible, and to facilitate knowledge exchange in ocean sciences. Ocean observations produced through regional systems and networks are key to effective ocean management. Three regional associations (RAs) located in the Pacific, the St. Lawrence, and the Atlantic work closely with local oceanographic communities to meet their needs for using CIOOS.

CIOOS Pacific
Through meaningful engagement and ongoing communication, CIOOS Pacific staff are developing a data management system that focuses on Canada’s West Coast. This system promotes easy access to ocean data and supports the work of partners, researchers, industry, coastal communities, First Nations, and non-profits. We are committed to the development of a data management and dissemination approach to meet the needs of the regional marine community and contribute to global ocean observing. Connect with us to contribute to the effort. 

Partners
Partnerships along the coast of British Columbia have been essential to observing the coastal ocean and this spirit continues in CIOOS Pacific. Academic, government, and non-profit organizations are founding members of CIOOS Pacific and we welcome additional organizations that will help elevate ocean monitoring on the coast. 

Join the CIOOS Partnership
Data Management
CIOOS believes in findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable (FAIR) data principles and open access of ocean data. To ensure interoperability with other national and international data repositories we have adopted standards for metadata (or data about data) that will help data consumers understand the origins of the original observations. 

CIOOS Data Management Practices
Essential Ocean Variables
CIOOS captures a selection of essential ocean variables (EOVs) aligned with the Global Ocean Observing System (GOOS), contributing to global efforts to better understand the ocean, marine issues, and interactions with other earth systems. These EOVs are initial targets for ingestion into CIOOS and additional data types will be added as the system matures.

properties.description:
Purpose of this site
This site (BODIK ODCS) is a cloud service that provides a free data catalog site for local governments to publish open data. For details, please see " What is BODIK ODCS?"

Open data is a global initiative that aims to improve administrative efficiency, resolve local issues, and revitalize local economies by making data held by governments publicly available under a license that allows secondary use. Europe and the United States have been leading the way, but following the Open Data Charter agreement at the 2013 G8 Summit, Japan also launched a national open data site ( DATA.GO.JP ), and advanced local governments have begun to actively work on open data.

Open data is expected to be put to effective use as a resource that will not run out even if the population or tax revenue declines, and in Europe and the United States, we are seeing many examples of its use, such as the efforts of NPOs that use open data to solve local issues and the success of venture companies that use open data. However, in Japan, the data has not yet been fully released, and as of March 2016, we have not yet reached that point.

There are still not many local governments working on open data. BODIK has released BODIK ODCS with the aim of supporting local governments in starting to work on open data, collecting open data from local governments, and building a social infrastructure that promotes the use of open data. We hope that this site will contribute to solving local issues and revitalizing the region.

properties.name: ufpe-open-data-portal
properties.title: UFPE Open Data Portal
properties.description:
The Federal University of Pernambuco Open Data Portal offers public data in an open format that can be freely accessed and used by all of society. The data available on the portal is published following international best practices and encompasses different categories such as: academic and administrative data. Open data is data that can be freely accessed, used, shared, and modified by any person and institution, restricted, at most, to preserving its origin and openness, such as, for example, citing the source or disclosing it with the same license. Therefore, the opening of data, in addition to benefiting users with quality and reliable data, also helps the disseminating institution itself to improve its management efficiency. Open data is a tool to help individuals, social movements, and public administration to develop improvements in their activities and measure their performance. In addition, they promote and stimulate the development of solutions that benefit society. The UFPE Open Data Portal is managed by the Superintendence of Information Technology (STI), through the Coordination of Governance and Management of ICT. For the publication of datasets, CKAN, a Web Data Management System (SGDW), is used. The institutional open data plan can be found at this link. Address: Av. Prof. Moraes Rego, 1235 - Cidade Universitária, Recife - PE, 50670-901 E-mail: dadosabertos@ufpe.br

*Translated from Portuguese*

---

**Original Text:**
O Portal de Dados Abertos da Universidade Federal de Pernambuco oferece dados públicos em formato aberto que podem ser livremente acessados e utilizados por toda a sociedade. Os dados disponíveis no portal são publicados seguindo as boas práticas internacionais e englobam diferentes categorias como: dados acadêmicos e administrativos. Dados abertos são dados que podem ser acessados, usados, compartilhados e modificados livremente por qualquer pessoa e instituição, restrito a, no máximo, preservar sua origem e abertura, como, por exemplo, citar a fonte ou divulgar com a mesma licença. Portanto, a abertura dos dados além de beneficiar as pessoas usuárias com dados de qualidade e fidelidade, também ajuda a própria instituição divulgadora a melhorar sua eficiência na gestão. Dados abertos é uma ferramenta para auxiliar indivíduos, movimentos sociais e gestão pública a desenvolver melhorias nas suas atividades e medir seu desempenho. Além disso, promovem e estimulam o desenvolvimento de soluções que beneficiem a sociedade. O Portal de Dados Abertos da UFPE é gerido pela Superintendência de Tecnologia da Informação (STI), através da Coordenação de Governança e Gestão de TIC. Para a publicação dos conjuntos de dados, é utilizado o CKAN, um Sistema Gerenciador de Dados na Web (SGDW). O plano de dados abertos institucional pode ser encontrado neste link. Endereço: Av. Prof. Moraes Rego, 1235 - Cidade Universitária, Recife - PE, 50670-901 E-mail: dadosabertos@ufpe.br

properties.name: adh-data-portal
properties.title: ADH Data Portal
properties.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has thrown up an array of data-related challenges. Across the continent, important datasets are either inaccessible to the public or are difficult to locate, retrieve and analyse. In some cases, the data simply does not exist yet. The Africa Data Hub serves to fill this gap by providing a free one-stop-shop for newsrooms, researchers, and the public to access near real-time COVID-19-related data in user-friendly formats. This CKAN portal serves as one feature of the Africa Data Hub where journalists and others can access COVID-19 and related data directly for their own analysis and inclusions in stories. This work is supported by the Bill & Melinda Gates foundation.

properties.name: mauritius-opendata-portal
properties.title: Mauritius Opendata Portal
properties.description: The Ministry of Information Technology, Communication and Innovation, in line with the e-Government Strategy and the Open Data Policy, has implemented the National Open Data portal which houses and provides links to the datasets of Government Agencies in an open format. This initiative empowers citizens and businesses for carrying out data-driven initiatives such as development of mobile apps, data analysis, creation of innovative products and research among others. By opening up data through the Open Data portal, Government aims to promote: • Transparency – citizens being able to freely access information about what their Government is doing; • Public Service Improvement – giving citizens the raw material to engage and contribute to making public services better as well as improve the quality of decision-making • Innovation – public data, and their re-use, are key resources for social innovation and economic growth where businesses and individuals can develop new tools and value-added services in order to work with, analyse, and make sense of the data. • Efficiency – Governments can come up with smarter and more efficient public services and applications by allowing information to be more easily reused within Government and enabling citizens to help improve data quality. The Ministry of Information Technology, Communication and Innovation, in line with the e-Government Strategy and the Open Data Policy, has implemented the National Open Data portal which houses and provides links to the datasets of Government Agencies in an open format. This initiative empowers citizens and businesses for carrying out data-driven initiatives such as development of mobile apps, data analysis, creation of innovative products and research among others. By opening up data through the Open Data portal, Government aims to promote: • Transparency – citizens being able to freely access information about what their Government is doing; • Public Service Improvement – giving citizens the raw material to engage and contribute to making public services better as well as improve the quality of decision-making • Innovation – public data, and their re-use, are key resources for social innovation and economic growth where businesses and individuals can develop new tools and value-added services in order to work with, analyse, and make sense of the data. • Efficiency – Governments can come up with smarter and more efficient public services and applications by allowing information to be more easily reused within Government and enabling citizens to help improve data quality.

properties.name: savenow-sddi-catalog
properties.title: SAVeNoW SDDI Catalog
properties.description:
This is the SDDI enabled catalog for SAVeNoW. This is a catalog of the SAVeNoW project based on the "Smart District Data Infrastructure" (SDDI) concept. The concept is being developed at the Chair of Geoinformatics, Technical University of Munich (TUM). The assignment of datasets to groups, as well as the number and division of the groups themselves, is the result of long and intensive consideration. The division into three main groups enables a simple search for datasets, as well as an easily understandable assignment to specific subject areas. Links between individual datasets are possible through a special extension and facilitate navigation. Smart District Data Infrastructure (SDDI) The catalog platform is part of the SDDI concept, which is used for data structuring in the area of Smart Cities and Regions. The idea of SDDI emerged in the course of the Europe-wide Smart Sustainable Districts project at the Chair of Geoinformatics at TUM, and is also the result of very long and extensive considerations. At the heart of the SDDI is the catalog platform, which manages the metadata of the individual datasets and provides an overview of the total inventory of all available data. The technical implementation of the catalog platform is based on the open-source software CKAN http://ckan.org/. For some of the functionalities, extensions are used, which partly come from the official CKAN extension library and partly were developed at the Chair of Geoinformatics at TUM. The catalog platform is operated in the backend via a PostgreSQL database http://postgresql.org/, which also enables the storage and processing of spatial data. Imprint: SAVeNoW, Schollstraße 26, 85055 Ingolstadt Email: info@savenow.de

*Translated from German*

---

**Original Text:**
This is the SDDI enabled catalog for SAVeNoW. Dies ist ein Katalog des SAVeNoW Projekts basierend auf dem „Smart District Data Infrastructure” (SDDI) Konzept. Das Konzept wird an der Lehrstuhl für Geoinformatik, Technische Universität München entwickelt. Die Zuordnung der Datensätze in Gruppen, sowie die Anzahl und Aufteilung der Gruppen selbst, istdas Ergebnis von langer und intensiver Überlegungen. Durch die Unterteilung in drei Hauptgruppen wird eine einfache Suche von Datensätzen, sowie eine leicht rsichtliche Zuordnung zu besimmten Themenbereichen ermöglicht. Verknüpfungen zwischen einzelnen Datensätzen sind durch eine spezielle Erweiterung möglich und erleichtern die Navigation. Smart District Data Infrastructure (SDDI) Die Katalogplattform ist Teil des SDDI-Konzepts, das für die Datenstrukturierung im Bereich der Smarten Städte und Regionen angewendet wird. Die Idee der SDDI ist im Zuge des europaweiten Smart Sustainable Districts Projektes am Lehrstuhl für Geoininformatik an der TUM entstanden, und ist ebenfalls das Ergebnis von sehr langen und ausgiebigen Überlegungen. Im Mittelpunkt der SDDI steht de Katalogplattform, welche die Metadaten der einzelnen Datensätze verwaltet und eine Übersicht über den Gesamtbestand aller Verfügbaren Daten liefert. Die Technische Umsetzung der Katalogplattform basiert auf der Open-Source Software CKAN http://ckan.org/. Für einige der Funktionalitäten werden Erweiterungen eingesetzt, welche zum einne Teil aus der offiziellen CKAN-Erweiterungsbibliothek stammen, und zum anderen Teil am Lehrstuhl für Geoinformatik der TUM entwickelt wurden. Die Katalogplattform wird im Backend über eine PostgreSQL Datenbank http://postgresql.org/ betrieben, welche auch die Speicherung und Verarbeitung von raumbezogenen Daten ermöglicht. Impressum: SAVeNoW, Schollstraße 26, 85055 Ingolstadt Email: info@savenow.de

properties.name: agriculture-littorale-data-catalog
properties.title: Agriculture Littorale Data Catalog
properties.description:
The data.agriculturelittorale.fr catalog makes available research data on the relationships between agriculture and coastal areas, derived from various programs in the humanities and social sciences, environmental sciences, and agronomic sciences. Created in 2019, this catalog was initially populated largely by the "Parchemins" (Paroles et chemins de l’agriculture littorale – Words and Paths of Coastal Agriculture) research program, which primarily disseminates qualitative data from ethnographic and agronomic surveys conducted in Brittany between 2016 and 2020, as well as quantitative and spatialized data on the evolution of agriculture in Brittany. In 2020, data.agriculturelittorale.fr also disseminates part of the data from the "Vivre avec l’algue verte" (Living with Green Algae) program collected during Alix Levain's doctoral research from 2010 to 2014 in Brittany (mainly extracts from municipal council deliberations of several municipalities in Finistère and Côtes d’Armor). The catalog is constantly evolving and intended to host new corpora from research programs documenting the relationships between agriculture and coastal areas. Any person or research program interested in depositing corpora in data.agriculturelittorale.fr is invited to contact the catalog administrator: data.agriculturelittorale[@]framalistes[point]org The catalog disseminates data of very diverse natures: quantitative corpora: for example, data on the evolution of the number of farms in a coastal area. spatialized data: for example, maps presenting studied sites, or the density of farms in a given territory. qualitative corpora: for example, extracts from municipal council deliberations of municipalities near the coast that mention decisions relating to agriculture, summaries of interviews conducted with farmers or residents of coastal regions, or photographs. The published data are subject to several licenses that define the terms of reuse of the disseminated content: either a public license (Licence Ouverte 2.0), or private licenses associated with research programs such as the Licence Parchemins. To consult data under private licenses, please follow the link indicated for each identified data set, which will put you in contact with the catalog administrators and the project concerned. The catalog offers several ways to explore the datasets: Data.agriculturelittorale.fr offers an indexing of content to facilitate the exploration of datasets by addressing different facets of the relationships between agriculture and the coastline: a series of keywords is associated with each data item, the list of which appears in the filter menu. When the source data is accessible under an open license, it can be viewed or downloaded via the "Explore" button. The data are described by metadata that gathers factual information (for example: format, collector, date, license, and associated project) and a description of the content (title, summary, keywords). The formats of the source files corresponding to each data item are diverse. They include text formats (.odt; .doc; .pdf), photo (.jpg), digitized document (.jpg; .pdf), cartographic (WMS; SHP), or sound (mp3). Who produces the datasets and populates the catalog? The data were collected by the "collectors" whose identity and contact information are mentioned in the metadata. In the vast majority of cases, these are researchers involved in a research project associated with the catalog. The collector owns the data that he/she has produced. They are processed (entered) by the "editors" (who may be the same as the collector) whose identity and contact information are mentioned in the metadata. They are affiliated with a research project mentioned in the "organization" box. The catalog is co-administered by UMR SAS (Unité mixte de recherche Sol, Agro et Hydrosystème, Spatialisation - Joint Research Unit Soil, Agro and Hydrosystem, Spatialization) and UMR AMURE (Centre de droit et économie de la mer - Center for Law and Economics of the Sea). Happy browsing!

*Translated from French*

---

**Original Text:**
Le catalogue data.agriculturelittorale.fr rend disponibles des données de recherche sur les relations entre agriculture et littorale issues de différents programmes en sciences humaines et sociales, sciences de l’environnement et sciences agronomiques. Créé en 2019, ce catalogue a d’abord été alimenté en grande partie par le programme de recherche « Parchemins » (Paroles et chemins de l’agriculture littorale), qui diffuse principalement des données qualitatives, issues d'enquêtes ethnographiques et agronomiques menées en Bretagne entre 2016 et 2020, et des données quantitatives et spatialisées sur l’évolution de l’agriculture en Bretagne. En 2020, data.agriculturelittorale.fr diffuse également une partie des données du programme « Vivre avec l’algue verte » collectées à l’occasion de la recherche doctorale d’Alix Levain de 2010 à 2014 en Bretagne (principalement des extraits de délibérations de conseils municipaux de plusieurs communes du Finistère et des Côtes d’Armor). Le catalogue est en évolution constante et voué à accueillir de nouveaux corpus issus de programmes de recherche documentant les relations entre agriculture et littoral. Toute personne ou programme de recherche intéressé pour déposer des corpus dans data.agriculturelittorale.fr est invité à contacter l'administrateur du catalogue : data.agriculturelittorale[@]framalistes[point]org Le catalogue diffuse des données de natures très diverses : des corpus quantitatifs : par exemple des données sur l’évolution du nombre d’exploitations agricoles sur un territoire littoral. des données spatialisées : par exemple des cartes présentant des sites étudiés, ou la densité d’exploitations agricoles sur un territoire donnée des corpus qualitatifs : par exemple, des extraits de délibérations de conseils municipaux de communes proches du littoral qui évoquent des décisions relatives à l’agriculture, des résumés d’entretiens réalisés auprès d’agriculteurs ou d’habitants de régions littorales, ou des photographies. Les données publiées relèvent de plusieurs licences qui définissent les modalités de ré-usages des contenus diffusés : soit une licence publique public (Licence Ouverte 2.0), soit des licences privées associées aux programmes de recherche telle que la Licence Parchemins. Pour consulter des données sous licences privées, merci de suivre le lien indiqué pour chaque donnée identifiée, qui vous mettra en contact avec les administrateurs du catalogue et le projet concerné. Le catalogue propose plusieurs modes d’exploration des jeux de données : Data.agriculturelittorale.fr propose une indexation des contenus pour faciliter l'exploration des jeux de données en abordant différentes facettes des relations entre agriculture et littoral : une série de mots clés est associée à chaque donnée, dont la liste apparait dans le menu des filtres. Lorsque la donnée source est accessible sous licence ouverte, elle peut être visionnée ou téléchargée via le bouton « Explorer ». Les données sont décrites par des métadonnées qui rassemblent des informations factuelles (par exemple : format, collecteur, date, licence et projet associé) et une description du contenu (titre, résumé, mots-clés). Les formats des fichiers sources correspondant à chaque donnée sont divers. Ils comprennent des formats texte (.odt ; .doc ; .pdf), photo (.jpg), document numérisé (.jpg ; .pdf), cartographique (WMS ; SHP), ou sonore (mp3). Qui produit les jeux de données et alimente le catalogue? Les données ont été collectées par les « collecteurs » dont l’identité et le contact sont mentionnés dans la métadonnée. Il s'agit, dans la grande majorité des cas, de chercheurs impliqués dans un projet de recherche associé au catalogue. Le collecteur est propriétaire des données qu’il.elle a produites. Elles sont traitées (saisies) par les « rédacteurs » (pouvant être identique au collecteur) dont l’identité et le contact sont mentionnés dans la métadonnée. Elles sont affiliées à un projet de recherche mentionné dans l’encart « organisation ». Le catalogue est co-administré par l'UMR SAS (Unité mixte de recherche Sol, Agro et Hydrosystème, Spatialisation) et l'UMR AMURE (Centre de droit et économie de la mer) Bonne navigation !

properties.name: opsi-open-data-slovenia
properties.title: OPSI - Open Data Slovenia
properties.description: The Government is releasing public data to become more transparent and foster innovation. Some of this data was available before, but data.gov.uk brings it together in one searchable website. Making this data easily available means it will be easier for people to make decisions and suggestions about government policies based on detailed information. Hear more about the Government's Transparency agenda from the Prime Minister in this video. There are datasets available from all central government departments and a number of other public sector bodies and local authorities. Is data just public information? Not really. From data.gov.uk, you can access the raw data driving government forward. This can then be used by people to build useful applications that help society, or investigate how effective policy changes have been over time. General public information - such as how to find out if you are entitled to tax credits, or how to tax your car - can be found at gov.uk. You can use the data in all sorts of ways. This may be simply to analyse trends over time from one policy area, or to compare how different parts of government go about their work. Technical users will be able to create useful applications out of the raw data files, which can then be used by everyone. data.gov.uk provides a mini-site of guidance for publishers, including step-by-step process for including your data on data.gov.uk. Please see: Data.gov.uk is a key part of the Government's work on Transparency and Data. The data.gov.uk implementation is being led by the Data team in the Cabinet Office, working across government departments to ensure that data is released in a timely and accessible way. This work is being supported by Sir Tim-Berners Lee & Professor Nigel Shadbolt. There are a number of technical partners involved in the project to date. These include the CKAN, which runs the catalogue at data.gov.uk/data as well as a growing number of open data registries around the world. It is a project originally created by the Open Knowledge Foundation to make it easy to find, share and reuse open content and data. The CKAN software provides a web interface, programmer's API, feeds notifying of changes, and a browsable history of all changes. The API is documented here: http://data.gov.uk/datametadata-api-docs. There are a number of ways of getting involved in the project, dependent on your background or interest. For example: If you wish to get involved in working with data you can check this very brief primer, you can also check out organisations such as the Open Data Institute and the Open Knowledge Foundation. To find out technical details about the setup of data.gov.uk go here. Hear more about the Government's Transparency agenda from the Prime Minister.

properties.name: nationaal-georegister-data-catalog
properties.title: Nationaal Georegister Data Catalog
properties.description:
About data.overheid.nl - National data portal Welcome to the National Data Portal of the Dutch government: data.overheid.nl. On this portal you will find data made available by the Dutch government. Facts and figures More than 180 government organizations have published data on data.overheid.nl. Almost all datasets are updated every night. The DCAT standard is used as the standard for exchanging descriptions of datasets and data services (metadata). Datasets are published via CKAN. The portal is maintained by the Knowledge and Exploitation Centre for Official Government Publications (External link)(KOOP) on behalf of the Ministry of the Interior and Kingdom Relations. Data.overheid.nl is a register and offers assistance with opening and reusing government data. More information about the policy in the Netherlands with regard to open data can be found here. In addition, information on closed data is also discoverable. Data.overheid.nl guides government organizations in making available data open. We also support re-users in finding specific open datasets. Data that are not (yet) available as open data can be made available as open data through a data request.

*Translated from Dutch*

---

**Original Text:**
Over data.overheid.nl - Nationale dataportaal Welkom op het Nationale Dataportaal van de Nederlandse overheid: data.overheid.nl. Op dit portaal vind je door de Nederlandse overheid beschikbaar gestelde data. Feiten en cijfers Meer dan 180 overheidsorganisaties hebben data op data.overheid.nl gepubliceerd. Vrijwel alle datasets worden iedere nacht geupdate. De DCAT-standaard wordt gebruikt als standaard om beschrijvingen over datasets en dataservices (metadata) met elkaar uit te wisselen. Datasets worden via CKAN gepubliceerd. Het portaal wordt onderhouden door het Kennis- en Exploitatiecentrum Officiële Overheidspublicaties (Externe link)(KOOP) in opdracht van het Ministerie van Binnenlandse Zaken en Koninkrijksrelaties. Data.overheid.nl is een register en biedt hulp bij het openen en hergebruik van data van de overheid. Meer informatie over het beleid in Nederland met betrekking tot open data kun je hier vinden. Daarnaast is vindbaar welke gesloten data er is. Data.overheid.nl begeleidt overheidsorganisaties bij het openstellen van beschikbare data. Ook ondersteunen we hergebruikers bij het vinden van specifieke open datasets. Data die (nog) niet als open data beschikbaar zijn, kunnen door middel van een dataverzoek als open data beschikbaar komen.

properties.name: data-sets-openig
properties.title: Data Sets - OPenIG
properties.description:
The 1901 law association OPenIG (Occitanie Pyrénées en Intelligence Géomatique) is the regional geographic information platform in Occitanie , resulting from the expansion in 2017 of the SIG LR association created in 1994. 

OPenIG pools tools and skills for its members, mainly local authorities, by offering data sharing services (via the Open Geographic Data Infrastructure, IDGO), expertise, facilitation of working groups and support around geographic data. 

*Translated from French*

---

**Original Text:**
L'association loi 1901 OPenIG (Occitanie Pyrénées en Intelligence Géomatique) est la plateforme régionale d'information géographique en Occitanie, issue de l’élargissement en 2017 de l’association SIG L-R créée en 1994. 

OPenIG mutualise outils et compétences pour ses adhérents, majoritairement des collectivités, en proposant des services de partage de données (via l’Infrastructure de Données Géographiques et Ouvertes, IDGO), d’expertise, d’animation de groupes de travail et d’accompagnement autour de la donnée géographique.

properties.name: sddi-catalog-bavaria
properties.title: SDDI Catalog Bavaria
properties.description:
The project "TwinBy – Digital Twins for Bavaria" supports the participating municipalities in the development and expansion of their own Digital Twins. For the planning and implementation of the Digital Twins, the Smart District Data Infrastructure (SDDI) of the Technical University of Munich is used as a uniform framework. This catalog service is based on open standards and is vendor-independent. Data can be integrated from different, decentrally stored or generated sources, allowing individual Digital Twins to be built up step by step. This domain contains the central SDDI catalog for the beneficiaries of the TwinBy project. The provision of this catalog is carried out by the Bavarian State Ministry for Digital Affairs in cooperation with byte, the Bavarian Agency for Digital Affairs. The SDDI catalog is operated by DKSR. The Super Admin role of the catalog lies with DKSR. For questions about the central SDDI catalog, please contact admin.DKSR@dksr.city.

*Translated from German*

---

**Original Text:**
Mit dem Projekt „TwinBy – Digitale Zwillinge für Bayern“ unterstützt das Bayerische Staatsministerium für Digitales die teilnehmenden Kommunen beim Auf- und Ausbau ihrer eigenen Digitalen Zwillinge. Für die Planung und Einführung der Digitalen Zwillinge wird dabei als einheitlicher Rahmen die Smart District Data Infrastructure (SDDI) der Technischen Universität München genutzt. Dieser Katalogdienst setzt auf offene Standards und ist herstellerunabhängig. Daten können aus unterschiedlichen, dezentral gespeicherten oder erzeugten Quellen eingebunden und damit individuelle Digitale Zwillinge schrittweise aufgebaut werden. Die vorliegende Domain beinhaltet den zentralen SDDI-Katalog für die Fördernehmer des Projekts TwinBy. Die Bereitstellung dieses Katalgos erfolgt durch das Bayerische Staatsministerium für Digitales in Zusammenarbeit mit der byte, der Bayerischen Agentur für Digitales. Der SDDI-Katalog wird durch DKSR betrieben. Die Super Admin Rolle des Katalogs liegt bei DKSR. Für Fragen zum zentralen SDDI-Katalog, wenden Sie sich bitte an admin.DKSR@dksr.city.

properties.name: native-lands-data-portal
properties.title: Native Lands Data Portal
properties.description: The native land data portal is part of the Native Land Information System and is for the storage and distribution of open data needed by Native people to protect their lands and plan for the future.

properties.name: connecticut-open-data-portal
properties.title: Connecticut Open Data Portal
properties.description: The Collaborative is a public-private partnership that advocates for the public availability of open and accessible data to drive planning, policy, budgeting and decision making in Connecticut at the state, regional and local levels. We are a user-driven organization, serving nonprofits, advocates, policymakers, community groups, and funders in using data to drive policy and improve programs and services. Michelle is responsible for executing the vision and strategy of the Collaborative which seeks to advance open data statewide and to facilitate data-driven decision making. She seeks to increase the use of public open data and grow the community of users across the state. Sasha Cuerda, Director of Technology: Sasha is a web developer with experience building data visualization tools, developing database systems for managing spatial data, and developing data processing workflows. He is also a trained urban planner and geographer. Brendan Swiniarski, Civics Applications Developer: Brendan is a web developer with experience designing user-centered web sites. He also processes data and develops metadata for CTData.org. properties.name: tusla-data-catalogue
properties.title: Tusla Data Catalogue
properties.description: The Tusla Performance Reporting Site https://data.tusla.ie and associated Data Catalogue https://datacatalog.tusla.ie are both key elements of improved capability for Tusla Data Management and have been implemented to facilitate Open data and Data Management developments in Tusla. This site seeks to improve the ability of Tusla to publish performance data (previously published) in a more modern, interactive and open way in line with current initiatives such as the Government Open Data Strategy 2017-2022. The site seeks to deliver on this strategy by making published performance related data held by Tusla in an easily accessible format online for reuse and redistribution. This initiative seeks to promote innovation, research, analysis and transparency through the publication of Public Sector data in open, free and reusable formats in line with the goals of the Open Data Strategy. Tusla will also seek to publish other approved and appropriate datasets over time in line with the initiative. The data on this website will be updated continuously. If you would like to suggest a new dataset to publish, or if you have any comments about existing datasets, please email Tusla Data Enquiries

What are open data.Data are considered open when they can be used, reused and freely redistributed by anyone.The only acceptable requirement regarding open data is that its source or authorship is credited, and that the user adopts the same public sharing policy.

---

**Translated from Portuguese**

---

O que são Dados Abertos. Os dados são considerados abertos quando podem ser usados, reutilizados e redistribuídos livremente por qualquer pessoa. A única exigência aceitável com relação a dados abertos é que seja creditada a sua fonte ou autoria, e que o usuário adote a mesma política de compartilhamento público.

properties.description:
"To develop an integrated transportation system to improve the quality of life for all segments of the population and drive the country's economy sustainably." 1) Manage policies and drive integrated strategies in accordance with the country's development direction. 2) Improve and develop infrastructure and traffic management systems to meet current and future needs. 3) Supervise and oversee with good governance, improve and develop legal systems and standards to keep pace with changes. 4) Continuously improve and develop the quality of transportation services. 5) Promote and support the creation of appropriate values for transportation system users and develop business capabilities. 6) Continuously manage and develop the organization towards excellence. "i-GETT" 1) Inclusive: Accessible services for all. 2) Green: Environmentally conscious. 3) Efficient: Effective and efficient. 4) Technology: Knowledgeable in the use of technology. 5) Transparent: Transparent.

*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
"พัฒนาระบบขนส่งอย่างบูรณาการ เพื่อยกระดับคุณภาพชีวิตของประชาชนทุกภาคส่วน และขับเคลื่อนเศรษฐกิจของประเทศอย่างยั่งยืน" 1) บริหารนโยบายและขับเคลื่อนยุทธศาสตร์อย่างบูรณาการให้สอดคล้องกับทิศทางการพัฒนาประเทศ 2) ปรับปรุงและพัฒนาโครงสร้างพื้นฐาน และระบบการจัดการการจราจรให้เพียงพอกับความต้องการทั้งปัจจุบันและอนาคต 3) กำกับ ดูแลอย่างมีธรรมาภิบาล ปรับปรุงพัฒนาระบบกฎหมายและมาตรฐานให้ทันต่อความเปลี่ยนแปลง 4) ปรับปรุงและพัฒนาการให้บริการการขนส่งให้มีคุณภาพอย่างต่อเนื่อง 5) ส่งเสริม สนับสนุนเพื่อสร้างค่านิยมที่เหมาะสมของผู้ใช้ระบบขนส่ง และพัฒนาขีดความสามารถในการประกอบการ 6) บริหารและพัฒนาองค์กรอย่างต่อเนื่องสู่ความเป็นเลิศ "i-GETT" 1) Inclusive บริการทั่วถึง 2) Green ใส่ใจสิ่งแวดล้อม 3) Efficient มีประสิทธิภาพ 4) Technology รู้จักใช้เทคโนโลยี 5) Transparent มีความโปร่งใส

properties.name: etda-data-catalog
properties.title: ETDA Data Catalog
properties.description:
Established in 2011, the Electronic Transactions Development Agency (ETDA) is an organization with the core responsibilities of promoting, supporting, and developing electronic transactions (e-Transactions) or online transactions under the Electronic Transactions Act B.E. 2544 (amended version) and the Electronic Transactions Development Agency Act B.E. 2562. ETDA's vision is to be an organization driving the economy and society with electronic transactions by fostering collaboration with all sectors to equally accommodate changes in line with the global landscape. This is to provide services to government agencies, private organizations, and the general public, enabling them to conveniently and quickly access and utilize important datasets. The Electronic Transactions Development Agency has created a data catalog for public dissemination on this website. If users encounter any issues while using the website, they can inquire further at [email protected].

*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
เป็นองค์กรที่ก่อตั้งขึ้นมาในปี 2554 ให้เป็นองค์กรที่มีหน้าที่สำคัญในการ ส่งเสริม สนับสนุน และพัฒนา ธุรกรรมทางอิเล็กทรอนิกส์ (e-Transactions) หรือ ธุรกรรมออนไลน์ ภายใต้ พระราชบัญญัติว่าด้วยธุรกรรมทางอิเล็กทรอนิกส์ พ.ศ. 2544 (ฉบับแก้ไขเพิ่มเติม) และ พระราชบัญญัติสำนักงานพัฒนาธุรกรรมทางอิเล็กทรอนิกส์ พ.ศ. 2562 ETDA มีวิสัยทัศน์ เป็นองค์กรขับเคลื่อนเศรษฐกิจและสังคม ด้วยธุรกรรมทางอิเล็กทรอนิกส์ โดยสร้างความร่วมมือกับทุกภาคส่วน เพื่อรองรับาการเปลี่ยนแปลงอย่างเท่าเทียมกันกับสถานการณ์โลก เพื่อให้บริการแก่หน่วยงาน องค์กรเอกชน และบุคคลทั่วไป ได้เข้าถึงและใช้ประโยชน์จากชุดข้อมูลสำคัญได้อย่างสะดวกและรวดเร็ว สำนักงานพัฒนาธุรกรรมทางอิเล็กทรอนิกส์ ได้จัดทำบัญชีชุดข้อมูลเพื่อเป็นการเผยแพร่สู่สาธารณะขึ้นในเว็บไซต์นี้ กรณีผู้ใช้บริการพบปัญหาจากการใช้งานสามารถสอบถามเพิ่มเติมได้ที่ [email protected]

properties.name: ieat-data-catalog
properties.title: IEAT Data Catalog
properties.description:
The Government Data Catalog (GD Catalog) is a central repository of digital accounts from government agencies that have undergone a governance process. It registers datasets for sharing and collaborative use of data from the agencies' original data sources. Datasets are categorized for ease of use and are also forwarded to the open data service platform, data.go.th, and the Government Data Exchange Center (GDX), as well as other platforms, to facilitate the shared use of government data. This aims to drive the country towards the goal of improving the well-being of its citizens.

*Translated from Thai*

---

**Original Text:**
ระบบบัญชีข้อมูลกลางภาครัฐ (Government Data Catalog : GD Catalog) ระบบบัญชีข้อมูลภาครัฐเป็นศูนย์รวมบัญชีดิจิทัลของหน่วยงานภาครัฐที่ผ่านกระบวนการธรรมาภิบาลและลงทะเบียนชุดข้อมูลเพื่อการแบ่งปันและใช้ประโยชน์ร่วมกันของข้อมูลจากแหล่งข้อมูลต้นทางของหน่วยงาน โดยจัดหมวดหมู่ให้พร้อมใช้งาน รวมถึงส่งต่อไปยังระบบบริการข้อมูลเปิด data.go.th และศูนย์กลางแลกเปลี่ยนข้อมูลภาครัฐ (GDX) ตลอดจนแพลตฟอร์มอื่นๆ เพื่อประโยชน์ในการใช้ข้อมูลภาครัฐร่วมกัน เพื่อนำไปสู่การขับเคลื่อนประเทศไปสู่เป้าหมายความอยู่ดีมีสุขของประชาชน

properties.name: arpae-emilia-romagna-data
properties.title: Arpae Emilia-Romagna Data
properties.description:
The Regional Agency for Prevention, Environment and Energy of Emilia-Romagna (Arpae), which integrates the functions of Arpa (established by Regional Law No. 44 of 1995) and the Environmental Services of the Provinces, was established by Regional Law No. 13/2015 and has been operational since January 1, 2016. Arpae exercises, in environmental and energy matters, the functions of granting, authorization, analysis, monitoring and control, in the following areas: water resources; atmospheric, electromagnetic and acoustic pollution, and activities at risk of major accidents; waste management and contaminated sites; environmental assessments and authorizations; use of state-owned water resources and mineral and thermal waters.

*Translated from Italian*

---

**Original Text:**
L´Agenzia regionale per la prevenzione, l´ambiente e l´energia dell´Emilia-Romagna (Arpae), che integra le funzioni di Arpa (istituita con la legge regionale n.44 del 1995) e dei Servizi ambiente delle Province, è stata istituita con legge regionale n.13/2015 ed è operativa dal primo gennaio 2016. Arpae esercita, in materia ambientale ed energetica, le funzioni di concessione, autorizzazione, analisi, vigilanza e controllo, nelle seguenti materie: risorse idriche; inquinamento atmosferico, elettromagnetico e acustico, e attività a rischio d´incidente rilevante; gestione dei rifiuti e dei siti contaminati; valutazioni e autorizzazioni ambientali; utilizzo del demanio idrico e acque minerali e termali.

properties.name: one-data-portal-sisada-pematangsiantar-city
properties.title: One Data Portal - SISADA Pematangsiantar City
properties.description:
About SISADA (Satu Data Information System) of Pematangsiantar City. Satu Data (One Data) is a government data governance policy aimed at creating quality data that is easily accessible and shareable between central and regional agencies. This policy is nationally stipulated in Presidential Regulation (PP) Number 39 of 2019 concerning Satu Data Indonesia (One Data Indonesia). In Pematangsiantar City, it is regulated in Mayor Regulation Number 5 of 2022 concerning Satu Data of Pematangsiantar City. Furthermore, the Pematangsiantar City Government is implementing Satu Data as a change project for the Administrator Leadership Training (PKA). SISADA of Pematangsiantar City is a website-based application owned by the Pematangsiantar City Government that provides data about the Pematangsiantar City Government for public access. The data presented is not state secrets, private secrets, or data that could harm many parties. Through SISADA, the Pematangsiantar City Government strives to build good data governance to realize government transparency and accountability, as well as national development. With the SISADA application, the public can search, view, and obtain or download the data provided. Pematangsiantar City Communication and Information Office, c/o Communication Services Division WhatsApp: (+62)853-5903-0365 (chat only), or please contact the relevant SKPD/OPD via email below:

*Translated from Indonesian*

---

**Original Text:**
Tentang SISADA (Sistem Informasi Satu Data) Kota Pematangsiantar Satu Data adalah kebijakan tata kelola data pemerintah yang bertujuan menciptakan data berkualitas, mudah diakses, dan dapat dibagipakaikan antar instansi pusat dan daerah. Kebijakan ini secara nasional tertuang dalam Peraturan Presiden (PP) Nomor 39 Tahun 2019 tentang Satu Data Indonesia. Di Kota Pematangsiantar diatur dalam Peraturan Wali Kota Nomor 5 Tahun 2022 tentang Satu Data Kota Pematangsiantar. Selain itu, Pemerintah Kota Pematangsiantar mengimplementasikan Satu Data sebagai proyek perubahan Pelatihan Kepemimpinan Administrator (PKA). SISADA Kota Pematangsiantar adalah aplikasi berbasis website milik Pemerintah Kota Pematangsiantar yang menyediakan data tentang Pemerintahan Kota Pematangsiantar untuk diakses masyarakat secara terbuka. Data yang disajikan bukan data bersifat rahasia negara, rahasia pribadi ataupun data yang dapat merugikan banyak pihak. Melalui SISADA, Pemerintah Kota Pematangsiantar berupaya membangun tata kelola data yang baik untuk terwujudnya transparansi dan akuntabilitas pemerintah, serta pembangunan nasional. Dengan aplikasi SISADA, masyarakat dimungkinkan mencari, melihat, dan memperoleh atau mengunduh data yang disediakan. Dinas Komunikasi dan Informatika Kota Pematangsiantar u.p. Bidang Layanan Komunikasi WhatsApp: (+62)853-5903-0365 (hanya melayani chat), atau Silahkan menghubungi SKPD/OPD terkait melalui email dibawah:

The DGCTA portal aims to disseminate and distribute information and databases of the Directorate-General for Territorial Care and Environment to both the public and personnel of local and national public administrations. Throughout the year, the datasets currently available on the portal will be integrated with additional data to provide a complete picture of the information held by the Directorate. For technical connection or consultation issues, please write to assistenzaDGCTAcatalogo@regione.emilia-romagna.it.

Nel corso dell'anno i dataset attualmente presenti nel portale verranno integrati con ulteriori dati fino a restituire il quadro completo dell'informazione detenuta dalla Direzione. Per informazioni di dettaglio su uno specifico dataset esposto nel portale DGCTA fare riferimento ai nominativi indicati nella relativa scheda del metadato associata.
